analyzed: gzhan yang snga na med pa 'byung ba na /

original: chags sogs nges med thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: chags sogs nges med thal bar 'gyur //

original: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ma 'das phyir //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ma 'das phyir //

original: thams cad chags sogs dang ldan na //
analyzed: thams cad chags sogs dang ldan na //

original: thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs can 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs can 'gyur //

original: 'byung ba phul du 'byung phyir min //
analyzed: 'byung ba phul du 'byung phyir min //

original: 'byung rnams srog @364b chags khyad med na'ang //
analyzed: 'byung rnams srog @364b chags khyad med na'ang //

original: khyad par 'di yi rten can gang //
analyzed: khyad par 'di yi rten can gang //

analyzed: de ni phul byung 'grib par ldan // de yod pa las de nyams 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gal te yang 'jig rten gzhan med na de'i tshe snga na med pa'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur na /

analyzed: de lta na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa ni nges pa med par 'gyur te /

analyzed: thams cad 'dod chags can du mi 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: la la 'dod chags bral bar ngang gis 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa med na skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'on te 'byung ba'i bdag nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin te /

analyzed: de thams cad kyis mi 'dor ba'i phyir skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad 'dod chags dang ldan par grub po zhe na /

analyzed: sa la sogs pa kha cig 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba nyid do //

analyzed: gang yang rung ba la smras pa ma yin no zer na /

original: srog chags srog chags ma yin par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba yang yin pa'i phyir rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: srog chags srog chags ma yin par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba yang yin pa'i phyir rtsod pa med do //

analyzed: srog chags nyid du tha mi dad la 'dod chags can du bye brag yod pa ma yin nam /

analyzed: de'i tshe sa la sogs pa'i 'byung @365a * //

analyzed: de lta na 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa las 'byung ba de nyams par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: kun la 'dod chags mtshungs par 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gal te rgyu phul du byung bar gyur kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa nyid gang yin pa de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa yin no //

analyzed: srog chags thams cad la 'dod chags mtshungs par 'gyur te /

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: la lar bdag nyid mtshungs pa las //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gal te yang chos can me yang gzhan yin la /

original: de bas na rtags khyad par dang bcas pa ste /

analyzed: gzhan gang la yod yon tan rnams //

analyzed: shin tu ba myong ldan pa can // de dag de las tha dad dang // la lar chad 'gyur dkar sogs bzhin //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: dper na sna ma bu la sogs pa rnams la dkar po la sogs pa @366a * //

analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa ni reg bya'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi /

analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa yon tan gyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: but white, etc. are by nature qualities,

analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa med kyang snam bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cloth, etc. exist even when white, etc. do not.

analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: rgyud gzhan la gnas pas 'gag pa'i chos can dang / skye ba'i chos can rnams de dag ni shin tu chad pa'i chos can te /
translated: The dharmas that exist in other continua, which are the dharmas that cease and the dharmas that arise, are the dharmas that are completely cut off,

original: dper na dkar po la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: dper na dkar po la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: like white, etc. This is the meaning of the summary.

original: 'on ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sa la sogs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa rnams kyi ches shin tu pa yang yin pa de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa ches shin tu ba yod kyang /
analyzed: 'on ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sa la sogs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa rnams kyi ches shin tu pa yang yin pa de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa ches shin tu ba yod kyang /
translated: Just as earth, etc. are not separate from form, etc., in the same way, even though attachment, etc. are completely cut off,

original: srog chags rnams 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral pa ni ma yin no zhen smras pa /üîΩde dag 'byung ba las tha dad //
analyzed: srog chags rnams 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral pa ni ma yin no zhen smras pa / de dag 'byung ba las tha dad //
translated: But it is not that living beings are free from attachment and so on.

original: med phyir gzugs sogs bzhin nges med //
analyzed: med phyir gzugs sogs bzhin nges med //
translated: They are not like form and so on, because they are not definitely ascertained to be different from the elements.

original: gal te de mtshungs zhe na min //üîΩchags sogs cig car skye thal phyir //
analyzed: gal te de mtshungs zhe na min // chags sogs cig car skye thal phyir //
translated: If you say that they are similar, no,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: because attachment and so on would be simultaneously generated.

original: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag 'byung ba med na mi 'byung ba ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na 'byung ba rnams las tha dad par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag 'byung ba med na mi 'byung ba ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na 'byung ba rnams las tha dad par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment and so on are not non-arisen when the elements are non-arisen, because they appear to be different from the elements.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa med kyang 'byung ba rnams mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa med kyang 'byung ba rnams mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus attachment and so on are seen even when the elements do not exist.

original: gzugs la sogs pa med na ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa med na ma yin no //
translated: But form and so on are not seen when they do not exist.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa la yang lus kyi 'byung ba chen po dang tha dad pa med pa nyid mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa la yang lus kyi 'byung ba chen po dang tha dad pa med pa nyid mtshungs te /
translated: Attachment and so on are similar in that they are not different from the great elements of the body.

original: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are they not like form and so on?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: No, they are not.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lus lhan cig dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lus lhan cig dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that desire and so on would be observed simultaneously with the body.

original: rtag tu lus dang 'dod chags lhan cig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu lus dang 'dod chags lhan cig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the body is not always observed simultaneously with desire.

original: gzhan yang 'byung ba chen por smra ba'i gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams las tha dad par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'byung ba chen por smra ba'i gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams las tha dad par mi rung ste /
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that form and so on, which are said to be the great elements, are different from the elements,

original: de kho na nyid mang por thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mang por thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that there would be many real natures.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yul las skye ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yul las skye ba ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt desire and so on produced from objects?

original: des na yul med na /
analyzed: des na yul med na /
translated: Therefore, if there are no objects,üîΩeven if the body exists, sometimes desire would not exist.

original: lus yod kyang res 'ga' 'dod chags med par 'gyur ro zhe na de ni bden pa ma yin te /üîΩrnam rtog @366b yul nyid yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lus yod kyang res 'ga' 'dod chags med par 'gyur ro zhe na de ni bden pa ma yin te / rnam rtog @366b yul nyid yin pa'i phyir //
translated: That is not so, because

original: yul ni nges byed ma yin no //
analyzed: yul ni nges byed ma yin no //
translated: the object is not the determiner,üîΩbecause it is the conceptual thought that is the object.

original: skal ba mnyam rgyu med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam rgyu med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no cause that is homogeneous,

original: chags sogs nges pa med pa'am //üîΩrgyu nye phyir na blo rnams kun //
analyzed: chags sogs nges pa med pa'am // rgyu nye phyir na blo rnams kun //
translated: desire and so on would not be determinate,üîΩor all cognitions would arise everywhere,

original: thams cad du ni skye bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad du ni skye bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: because the cause is near.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yul gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yul gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Attachment, etc. do not follow or cease in accordance with the object,

original: de med kyang bag chags las yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang bag chags las yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they exist due to the latent impressions, even when the object is absent.

original: des na gzugs la sogs pa yul ni nges par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa yul ni nges par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, form, etc. are not the determining factors of the object,

original: bdag dang bdag gir rtog pas bstan pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir rtog pas bstan pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is taught to be the subjective aspect, which is the conception of self and what belongs to self.

original: de bzhin du bdag dang bdag gi ba yod na 'dod chags 'phel bar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'jig rten rgyang pan pa la ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag dang bdag gi ba yod na 'dod chags 'phel bar 'gyur ro // 'jig rten rgyang pan pa la ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, attachment increases when there is self and what belongs to self.üîΩIn the Lokayatas, attachment, etc. are never produced without a homogeneous cause,

original: rigs mthun pa'i rgyu med par 'dod chags la sogs pa nam yang skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i rgyu med par 'dod chags la sogs pa nam yang skye ba ma yin no //
translated: because there is no cause of a similar type.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i grogs tsam byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i grogs tsam byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they must be the mere companions of attachment, etc.

original: yang na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i blo thams cad cig car skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i blo thams cad cig car skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, all the cognitions of attachment, etc. would be produced simultaneously,üîΩbecause the cause of a similar type would always be present.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu lus nye bar mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu lus nye bar mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of attachment and so on is the body, which is similar in all.

original: 'o na gal te da ltar ba'i tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las skye ba yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te da ltar ba'i tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las skye ba yin na /
translated: If attachment and so on arise from the habit of attachment and so on in the present life,

original: de lta na yang dang po skyes pa'i sems ma'i mngal du goms pa las skyes par cis shes she na /
analyzed: de lta na yang dang po skyes pa'i sems ma'i mngal du goms pa las skyes par cis shes she na /
translated: how do you know that attachment and so on in the first life arise from the habit of attachment and so on in the previous birth?

original: de lta na 'o na ni du ba thams cad kyang me las skyes par gang du mthong /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni du ba thams cad kyang me las skyes par gang du mthong /
translated: If that is so, then how do you know that all smoke arises from fire?

original: 'on te du ba de la yang me med na me 'byung bar nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'on te du ba de la yang me med na me 'byung bar nges pa med de /
translated: If there is no fire in that smoke, then it is not certain that fire will arise.

original: me'i rjes thogs su mthong ba'i du ba gang yin pa de nyid de ltar yin no zhe na /
analyzed: me'i rjes thogs su mthong ba'i du ba gang yin pa de nyid de ltar yin no zhe na /
translated: You may say that the smoke that is seen after fire is like that,

original: de lta na yang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad thams cad chad par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad thams cad chad par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: but if that is so, then it follows that all mundane conventions are annihilated,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa khas blangs nas su yang tha snyad 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum ni tha snyad ci yang byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa khas blangs nas su yang tha snyad 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum ni tha snyad ci yang byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because no one posits conventions on the basis of accepting a relation between cause and effect, and because direct perception does not perform any function at all.

original: mngon sum gyis na rtsva mchog la glang po che yod par rtogs par mi nus pa de bas na tha mi dad par mthong ba nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis na rtsva mchog la glang po che yod par rtogs par mi nus pa de bas na tha mi dad par mthong ba nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not possible to understand that an elephant exists in a clump of grass by means of perception, therefore, if they were seen to be undifferentiated, the conventions of cause and effect would be undermined.

original: 'on te brdar btags pa spong bar mi nus pa'i phyir de'i rigs dpags pa las btags so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te brdar btags pa spong bar mi nus pa'i phyir de'i rigs dpags pa las btags so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that because it is impossible to eliminate the conventional designation, it is designated from the inference of its type,

original: de lta na yang 'jig rten pha rol yang de'i rigs dpags pa las tha snyad du 'jig rten pha rol yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'jig rten pha rol yang de'i rigs dpags pa las tha snyad du 'jig rten pha rol yod par 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case, the world beyond would also exist conventionally from the inference of its type.

original: 'jig rten 'di @367a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di @367a * //
translated: It would be like this world.

original: bzhin no // de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las 'byung zhing /
analyzed: bzhin no // de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las 'byung zhing /
translated: Therefore, the result of attachment and so on arises from the cultivation of attachment and so on,

original: goms pa de yang 'dod chags gzhan goms pa las skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: goms pa de yang 'dod chags gzhan goms pa las skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: and that cultivation arises from the cultivation of another attachment.

original: bde ba la sogs pa thog ma med pa'i bag chags las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa thog ma med pa'i bag chags las skyes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, pleasure and so on arise from beginningless latent propensities,

original: don dam par ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: de'i phyir dngos su ni thams cad sdug bsngal kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos su ni thams cad sdug bsngal kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, in reality, everything is only suffering.

original: res 'ga' zhig ni dmigs phyir te //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig ni dmigs phyir te //
translated: Sometimes, it is because of the object.üîΩSuffering is due to the power of cause,

original: mi brtan nyes la brten phyir dang // rgyu yi dbang nyid phyir sdug bsngal //
analyzed: mi brtan nyes la brten phyir dang // rgyu yi dbang nyid phyir sdug bsngal //
translated: because of instability, and because of dependence on faults.

original: bdag min byin gyis brlabs pa'ang min //
analyzed: bdag min byin gyis brlabs pa'ang min //
translated: It is not the self, nor is it consecrated to the self.

original: rgyu min byin gyis rlob pa min //
analyzed: rgyu min byin gyis rlob pa min //
translated: It is not the cause, nor is it consecrated to the cause.

original: rtag na'ang ji ltar rgyu ru 'gyur //üîΩde phyir du ma de gcig la //
analyzed: rtag na'ang ji ltar rgyu ru 'gyur // de phyir du ma de gcig la //
translated: If it were permanent, how could it be a cause?üîΩTherefore, the many are not born from the one

original: dus tha dad par skye mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la //
analyzed: dus tha dad par skye mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la //
translated: at different times.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni /
translated: Here, the truth of suffering

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa las rnam pa bzhir bstan to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa las rnam pa bzhir bstan to //
translated: is taught to have four aspects: impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and non-self.

original: de la sdug bsngal te dus res 'ga' dmigs pa'i phyir mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal te dus res 'ga' dmigs pa'i phyir mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Among them, suffering is impermanent because it is sometimes perceived.

original: rtag pa ni gtan du ba bltar rung ba'i ngo bo yin pas res 'ga' dmigs par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa ni gtan du ba bltar rung ba'i ngo bo yin pas res 'ga' dmigs par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If it were permanent, it would be an essence that could always be perceived, and it would not be reasonable to perceive it sometimes.

original: bltar rung ba dang / mi rung ba'i ngo bo dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bltar rung ba dang / mi rung ba'i ngo bo dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the essence of what can be perceived and what cannot be perceived would be mutually exclusive and contradictory.

original: rgyu'i dbang nyid kyi phyir yang sdug bsngal pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i dbang nyid kyi phyir yang sdug bsngal pa ste /
translated: It is also suffering because it is a causal power.

original: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: It is reasonable to say that everything that is under the control of another is suffering.

original: dang gi sgras ni goms pa'i dbang du gyur pa nyid kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dang gi sgras ni goms pa'i dbang du gyur pa nyid kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù indicates that it is also suffering because it is under the control of habit.

original: bdag gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the self that is the essence of the self,üîΩnor is it the self that is empowered by the self,

original: bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir bdag ni rgyu ma yin zhing byin gyis rlob pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir bdag ni rgyu ma yin zhing byin gyis rlob pa yang ma yin te /
translated: because the self is neither a cause nor an empowering condition.

original: byin gyis rlob pas ni byed pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pas ni byed pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it were an empowering condition, it would be an agent.

original: byed pa dang bcas na ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: byed pa dang bcas na ni rgyu yin no //
translated: If it were an agent, it would be a cause.

original: 'o na yang bdag ni rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yang bdag ni rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: But the self is a cause.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gang gi phyir bdag la sogs pa rtag pa skyed byed du mi rung la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag la sogs pa rtag pa skyed byed du mi rung la /
translated: because it is not reasonable that a permanent self, etc.

original: mi skyed na ni ri bong gi rva bzhin med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi skyed na ni ri bong gi rva bzhin med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not produce, it does not exist, like the horn of a donkey.

original: de bas na 'bras bu du ma dus tha dad par bdag la sogs pa rtag pa las skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu du ma dus tha dad par bdag la sogs pa rtag pa las skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, a permanent self and so on do not produce multiple effects at different times.

original: 'o na bdag gis byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i mig la sogs pas ji ltar shes pa skyed par byed /
analyzed: 'o na bdag gis byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i mig la sogs pas ji ltar shes pa skyed par byed /
translated: But how does the eye faculty and so on that is not empowered by the self generate consciousness?

original: des na 'bras bu shes pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu shes pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since it is untenable that consciousness is another effect,

original: bdag byed pa @367b por dpag go zhe na /
analyzed: bdag byed pa @367b por dpag go zhe na /
translated: the self is inferred to be the agent.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: rgyu gzhan dag ni nye ba na'ang //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan dag ni nye ba na'ang //
translated: Even when other causes are present,

original: 'bras bu dag ni mi skyed phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag ni mi skyed phyir //
translated: effects are not produced.

original: rgyu gzhan rjes su dpog 'gyur na //üîΩde ni rtag rnams la yod min //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan rjes su dpog 'gyur na // de ni rtag rnams la yod min //
translated: If other causes are inferred,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: that does not exist for permanent things.

original: gal te mig las gzhan rnams tshogs kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skyed cing /
analyzed: gal te mig las gzhan rnams tshogs kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skyed cing /
translated: Here, even when the other conditions such as form are assembled, if the eye consciousness is not produced,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and when the eye consciousness is produced,

original: rgyu gzhan pa rjes su dpag par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan pa rjes su dpag par bya ste /
translated: other causes are inferred.

original: gang zhig med par 'bras bu mi skyed pas /
analyzed: gang zhig med par 'bras bu mi skyed pas /
translated: Since an effect is not produced in the absence of a cause,

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i mig la sogs pa tsam las shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i mig la sogs pa tsam las shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness arises from the mere blessing of the eye faculty and so on, which are similar and immediately antecedent conditions.

original: gang gis bdag med na shes pa med par 'gyur ba'i bdag rtag pa dang / khyab pa la ni /
analyzed: gang gis bdag med na shes pa med par 'gyur ba'i bdag rtag pa dang / khyab pa la ni /
translated: If the self were permanent and all-pervading, it would never be separated from anything,

original: nam yang gang du yang bral ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam yang gang du yang bral ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would never be separated from anything.

original: 'o na te ldog pa med par yang bdag yod pa tsam gyis bdag gis skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na te ldog pa med par yang bdag yod pa tsam gyis bdag gis skyed do zhe na /
translated: But if the self exists merely without separation, it would generate consciousness.

original: 'o na nam mkha' la sogs pa dag kyang mig la sogs pa byin gyis rlob par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na nam mkha' la sogs pa dag kyang mig la sogs pa byin gyis rlob par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Then even space and so on would bless the eye faculty and so on,

original: de dag kyang rtag pa dang khyab pas shes pa skye ba'i tshe yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang rtag pa dang khyab pas shes pa skye ba'i tshe yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they exist at the time of the arising of consciousness, since they are permanent and all-pervading.

original: de bas na yod pa tsam gyis bdag rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yod pa tsam gyis bdag rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mere existence of the self is not the cause of the self.

original: res 'ga' 'byung ba dag gis ni //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'byung ba dag gis ni //
translated: Sometimes the elements

original: sdug bsngal 'di rgyu can nyid grub //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di rgyu can nyid grub //
translated: establish that suffering has a cause.

original: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
analyzed: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
translated: Because it is causeless and does not depend on another,

original: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur //
translated: it would always exist or not exist.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The truth of origination is also fourfold:

original: rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa las yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa las yin te /
translated: as cause, origination, strong generation, and condition.

analyzed: de la rgyu ni rgyu ma yin pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //

original: bde ba blang ba dang / sdug bsngal dor bar 'dod pa de dag ni 'dod pa dang bral ba dang / sred pa'i 'dod pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir kun 'byung bar bstan pa la 'gal ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: bde ba blang ba dang / sdug bsngal dor bar 'dod pa de dag ni 'dod pa dang bral ba dang / sred pa'i 'dod pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir kun 'byung bar bstan pa la 'gal ba ci yang med do //
translated: Those who desire to take up pleasure and to cast off pain are said to be free from desire and to have the desire of craving. Therefore, there is no contradiction at all in teaching the origin of suffering.

original: rkyen gyi rnam pa bzhi pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rkyen gyi rnam pa bzhi pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the fourth aspect of the condition,üîΩhe says,üîΩThe one who perceives as pleasure

original: bde min la bder 'du shes pa'i //
analyzed: bde min la bder 'du shes pa'i //
translated: that which is not pleasure

original: kun la rab tu 'jug pa la //
analyzed: kun la rab tu 'jug pa la //
translated: is completely immersed in all.

original: bdag @369b la chags pa rgyu nyid phyir //
analyzed: bdag @369b la chags pa rgyu nyid phyir //
translated: Because of attachment to self,

original: de phyir sred pa srid rten yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de phyir sred pa srid rten yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: craving is the support of existence.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang ldan pa gcig tu sgro 'dogs pa nyid kyi sems ni bdag tu zhen pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang ldan pa gcig tu sgro 'dogs pa nyid kyi sems ni bdag tu zhen pa ste /
translated: The mind that is completely immersed in the superimposition of self is attachment to self, which is to grasp at self.

original: bdag de la chags pa gang yin pa de ni gnas thams cad du 'jug pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: bdag de la chags pa gang yin pa de ni gnas thams cad du 'jug pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Whatever attachment there is to that self is the cause of engaging in all abodes.

original: gang gi zhe na dom par bde ba dang bral ba la /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na dom par bde ba dang bral ba la /
translated: To what? To that which is not pleasure.

original: bde bar phyin ci log pas bslad pa yis te /
analyzed: bde bar phyin ci log pas bslad pa yis te /
translated: Because of the error of misapprehending that which is not pleasure as pleasure,

original: de'i phyir sred pa ni sred pa'i rten yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir sred pa ni sred pa'i rten yin gyi /
translated: therefore craving is the support of existence.

original: sred pa med na gang gang du yang mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa med na gang gang du yang mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were no craving, one would not engage in anything anywhere.

original: snying rjes ni sred pa med par yang skye ba len par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: snying rjes ni sred pa med par yang skye ba len par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: But through compassion, one takes birth even without craving.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rab tu 'jug pa na sred pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rkyen tsam ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rab tu 'jug pa na sred pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rkyen tsam ste /
translated: Therefore, craving is merely a condition for engagement, because it is the cooperative cause.

original: nye bar len pa nyid ni ma yin te sems nyid skye ba nye bar len pa yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa nyid ni ma yin te sems nyid skye ba nye bar len pa yin te /
translated: Craving is not the appropriator, because the mind itself is the appropriator of birth.

original: de'i rkyen ni sred pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i rkyen ni sred pa yin zhing /
translated: Craving is the condition for that.

original: res 'ga' snying rje yang yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' snying rje yang yin no //
translated: Sometimes compassion is also.

original: de dag gis ni rkyen gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni rkyen gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, the aspect of condition has been taught.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is how it is.

original: rkyen gyi rnam pa nyid ni yod kyang /
analyzed: rkyen gyi rnam pa nyid ni yod kyang /
translated: Although the aspect of condition exists,

original: srid pa ni rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: srid pa ni rkyen ma yin te /
translated: existence is not a condition.

original: 'on kyang lus yin pa'i phyir lus dang ldan pa dag 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang lus yin pa'i phyir lus dang ldan pa dag 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: However, in order to teach that one does not become free from attachment because the body is the appropriator,

original: chags bral skye ba ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: chags bral skye ba ma mthong phyir //
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúBecause one does not see the birth of one free from attachment.‚Äù

original: zhes ni slob dpon rnams kyis bshad //üîΩlus med chags pa ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: zhes ni slob dpon rnams kyis bshad // lus med chags pa ma mthong phyir //

original: lus las 'dod chags 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lus las 'dod chags 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Desire arises from the body, because one does not see desire in the absence of a body.üîΩDesire arises from the body, because one does not see desire in the absence of a body.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba skye ba ma mthong ba'i phyir 'dod chags ni skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes slob dpon gyis bshad pa bzhin du /

original: lus med pa la chags pa ma mthong ba'i phyir lus las 'dod chags 'byung ngo zhes kho bo yang smra'o //
analyzed: lus med pa la chags pa ma mthong ba'i phyir lus las 'dod chags 'byung ngo zhes kho bo yang smra'o //

analyzed: 'dir smras pa 'dod chags med kyang snying rje'i stobs kyis skye ba 'byung bas /

analyzed: skye ba gzhan mngon par 'dod pa'i yul ni sred pas byas pa yin no //

original: dga' ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dga' ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Craving is the cause of the special joy.

original: sred pa ni rab tu skye ba tsam yin no //
analyzed: sred pa ni rab tu skye ba tsam yin no //
translated: Therefore, craving is the cause of birth.

original: de bzhin du gal te lus kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i grogs tsam yin la /

analyzed: des na lus dang 'dod chags phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de ltar gyur pa thog ma med pa'i rgyu tshan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the reason why this has been so from beginningless time.

analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the existence of other worlds is established.

original: rdzas dang yon tan lhan cig skye ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rdzas dang yon tan lhan cig skye ba ma yin nam /
translated: Are not substance and quality co-present?

original: de'i phyir lus dang / 'dod chags phan tshun rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus dang / 'dod chags phan tshun rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, body and attachment are not reciprocally causes.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gal te skye la chags mthong phyir /
analyzed: gal te skye la chags mthong phyir /
translated: If attachment is seen to arise,

original: skye dang lhan cig 'byung na ni //üîΩskal mnyam skye bar sngar grub 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang lhan cig 'byung na ni // skal mnyam skye bar sngar grub 'gyur //
translated: if it arises simultaneously with body,

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩgal te 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then the homogeneous cause would be established prior to arising.üîΩHere, if attachment and so on are not the cause of body because they arise simultaneously with body,

original: de lta na ni lus kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur te lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni lus kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur te lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then body also would not be the cause of attachment and so on because they are co-present.

original: rgyu med pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: And they are not causeless.

original: de bas na rigs mthun pa'i rgyu lus las sngon du grub pa'i phyir 'jig rten gzhan grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rigs mthun pa'i rgyu lus las sngon du grub pa'i phyir 'jig rten gzhan grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the body, which is the cause of a similar type, is already established, the establishment of another world is established.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi sred pa nyid gcig pu rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi sred pa nyid gcig pu rgyu ma yin te /
translated: This is so, but craving alone is not the cause.

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las zhes bya ba gsum skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las zhes bya ba gsum skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ignorance, craving, and action are the three causes of birth.

original: des na ni ji ltar sred pa nyid de dang de la mngon bar dga' ba'i phyir rgyur brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na ni ji ltar sred pa nyid de dang de la mngon bar dga' ba'i phyir rgyur brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how can craving alone be called the cause, because of the delight in this and that?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: srid la mi shes rgyu yin yang //
analyzed: srid la mi shes rgyu yin yang //
translated: Although ignorance is the cause of existence,

original: ma brjod sred pa nyid bshad pa //
analyzed: ma brjod sred pa nyid bshad pa //
translated: craving alone is explained as the cause.üîΩBecause the continuum is projected by it,

original: rgyun ni 'phen par byed phyir dang // de ma thag phyir las las kyang //
analyzed: rgyun ni 'phen par byed phyir dang // de ma thag phyir las las kyang //
translated: and because it is immediate, it is also from action.

original: de yod na yang mi 'byung phyir //
analyzed: de yod na yang mi 'byung phyir //
translated: Because it does not occur even when it exists,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: this is said.

original: srid pa'i rgyur ma rig pa dang / las dag 'gyur yang mchod pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyur ma rig pa dang / las dag 'gyur yang mchod pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin te /
translated: Although ignorance and action are the causes of existence, they are not the causes of the appearance of craving.

original: sred pa nyid de ma thag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ta /
analyzed: sred pa nyid de ma thag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ta /
translated: Craving alone is the immediate cause.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyun 'phen par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyun 'phen par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it projects the stream of cyclic existence.

original: gti mug dang las dag yod kyang sred pa med par gang du yang 'phen par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gti mug dang las dag yod kyang sred pa med par gang du yang 'phen par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though delusion and karma exist, without craving, there is no projection of rebirth,

original: dngul du 'khrul na yang sred pa med na 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i @370b phyir ro //üîΩde bas na rgyu yin yang mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: dngul du 'khrul na yang sred pa med na 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i @370b phyir ro // de bas na rgyu yin yang mi shes pa ste /
translated: because even if one mistakes a rope for a snake, if one has no craving, one will not enter.

original: ma rig pa ma brjod kyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa ma brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, even though it is a cause, ignorance is not mentioned.

original: 'on kyang sred pa nyid brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang sred pa nyid brjod do //
translated: But craving is mentioned.

original: ma chod par skye ba'i rgyu las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma chod par skye ba'i rgyu las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is craving the cause of birth that is not interrupted,

original: las de yod kyang sred pa med na skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las de yod kyang sred pa med na skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though karma exists, if craving does not exist, birth is impossible.

original: 'di ltar las las skyes pa'i nor la sred pa med na yongs su spong bar byed do //üîΩde ltar re zhig kun 'byung gi bden pa rnam pa bzhir bstan nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar las las skyes pa'i nor la sred pa med na yongs su spong bar byed do // de ltar re zhig kun 'byung gi bden pa rnam pa bzhir bstan nas /
translated: Thus, if one has no craving for wealth that arises from karma, one will abandon it.üîΩThus, the truth of origination is shown to have four aspects.

original: da ni 'gog pa'i bden pa rnam pa bzhir bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'gog pa'i bden pa rnam pa bzhir bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show the four aspects of the truth of cessation,üîΩit is said:

original: de ni gtan du ba min te //
analyzed: de ni gtan du ba min te //
translated: It is not permanent,

original: rgyu la gags ni srid phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la gags ni srid phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible to block the cause.

original: 'khor ba nyid phyir thar pa med //üîΩ'dod dang ma grub phyir ma yi //
analyzed: 'khor ba nyid phyir thar pa med // 'dod dang ma grub phyir ma yi //
translated: Samsara itself is not liberation.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of desire and non-establishment, it is not.

original: 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba las 'gog pa'i bden pa rnam bzhi ste 'gog pa nyid med do zhes smras pa dang / 'gog pa'i rnam par brjod do //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba las 'gog pa'i bden pa rnam bzhi ste 'gog pa nyid med do zhes smras pa dang / 'gog pa'i rnam par brjod do //
translated: Here, in the four aspects of cessation, peace, excellence, and definite emergence, cessation is said to be non-existent.

original: grol ba rnams la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ngo zhes gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de dgag pa'i phyir zhi ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: grol ba rnams la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ngo zhes gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de dgag pa'i phyir zhi ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: In order to refute the assertion by others that desire and so forth arise even for the liberated, there is the aspect of peace.

original: 'di las gzhan pa'i thar pa yod do zhes bya ba de'i gnyen por gya nom pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa'i thar pa yod do zhes bya ba de'i gnyen por gya nom pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the assertion There is liberation other than this is the aspect of excellence.

original: grol ba yang ma grul bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de dag bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grol ba yang ma grul bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de dag bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the claim that the liberated would become non-liberated,

original: nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhin yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhin yin no //
translated: there is the aspect of definite emergence.

original: de la rnam pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal de gtan tu bar yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rnam pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal de gtan tu bar yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The first of these is taught in order to show that this suffering is not permanent, but rather is subject to cessation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la gegs byed pa la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la gegs byed pa la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is possible to obstruct the cause of suffering, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyu ma tshang pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyu ma tshang pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the incompleteness of the cause, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang bral na sdug bsngal nyid kyang ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gog par srid pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang bral na sdug bsngal nyid kyang ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gog par srid pa yin no //
translated: When one is separated from the cause of suffering, suffering itself is stopped, and thus cessation is possible.

original: 'o na gal te shes pa'i rgyun chang pa nyid thar pa ste me bzhin du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te shes pa'i rgyun chang pa nyid thar pa ste me bzhin du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod na /
translated: If the stream of consciousness itself is nirvana, like the extinction of a fire,

original: 'o na ni tha ma'i sems yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni tha ma'i sems yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the final moment of consciousness would not exist,

original: don byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be devoid of any function.

original: 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes skyed par nus pa tha ma'i sems la yod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes skyed par nus pa tha ma'i sems la yod na ni /

original: 'o na tha ma nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na tha ma nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //

original: 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la tha mi'i sems grogs byed pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la tha mi'i sems grogs byed pa tsam yin te /

original: shes pa gzhan gyi nye bar len par mi 'gyur bas tha ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyi nye bar len par mi 'gyur bas tha ma nyid yin no //
translated: But it is not the appropriator of another consciousness, and so it is the last mind.

original: 'o na nye bar len pa'i rgyu ci yin /
analyzed: 'o na nye bar len pa'i rgyu ci yin /

original: rigs mthun pa'o zhe na /üîΩ'dod chags bral ba dang / @371a * //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'o zhe na / 'dod chags bral ba dang / @371a * //

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dag la rigs mthun pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dag la rigs mthun pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there a homogeneous cause for the mind of one free from attachment and for the mind of omniscience?

original: ji ltar tha ma'i sems nye bar len pa ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar tha ma'i sems nye bar len pa ma yin /

analyzed: de med na yang de'i gong ma yang med bas snga ma snga ma med par 'gyur te /

analyzed: don byed pa med pa'i phyir ma yin nam zhe na /

analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa tsam nyid thar pa ste /

analyzed: de dag snga phyir rtogs na rigs pa med par brtsad pa yin no //

analyzed: de ltar yang 'di shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa'o zhes bshad par bya'o //

original: don byed pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa yang 'dir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: don byed pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa yang 'dir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don 'di nyid yin no //

analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar don byed pa ni rgyu yod pa de ltar bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu yang yod de /

analyzed: 'di ltar tha ma'i sems thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi grogs byed pa ste /

original: dper na myu gu la sa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na myu gu la sa bzhin no //

original: sa myu gu'i rgyu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sa myu gu'i rgyu ni ma yin gyi /

analyzed: myu gu gnas na sa'i rgyun 'chad pa ma yin te /

analyzed: sa bon ni myu gu dang rgyud gcig pa'o //

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i rgyun chad kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyun 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i rgyun chad kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyun 'jug pa yin no //

analyzed: gang yang shes pa yin pa'i phyir tha ma'i shes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi nye bar len par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba 'di la smras pa ni /

analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skye ba de @371b ni rgyud tha dad pa yin pa de bzhin du /

analyzed: sdug bsngal log pa'i ngo bo nyid thar pa yin no //

analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod chags la sogs pas dben pa'i sems ni thar pa ste /

analyzed: des na yongs su dag pa'i sems 'dod chags dang bral ba rtag tu yod pa'o //

analyzed: de bas na 'khor ba las thar pa mi 'grub po zhe na /

original: de ni 'dod pas nyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pas nyes pa ma yin te /

analyzed: de bas na 'khor ba'i phyir zhes pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir thar pa med do zhes zer ba 'di mi rigs te ;

analyzed: grol ba gang yin ba'i grol ba bo yang yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: 'o na gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i las kyis gnas par byed na de'i tshe 'jig rten gzhan du byas pa'i las yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If one were to abide due to the karma of one who is free from attachment, then at that time, due to the existence of karma that is created in another world,

analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol dang mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /

analyzed: 'on te las te nus pa med na ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas pa de med par 'gyur ro zhe na /

analyzed: 'phangs la ldog pa med 'dod phyir //
translated: Because it is asserted that what is projected cannot be stopped,

original: srid pa'i sred las rnam rgal ba'i //
analyzed: srid pa'i sred las rnam rgal ba'i //
