translated: And it is also refuted that the permanent produces an effect in dependence on the assistance of a cooperating condition.

original: dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa ni thar pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa ni thar pa ste /
translated: Liberation is the state of being free from suffering, the state of being free from the cause of suffering, and the state of being established in the nature of joy.

original: de lta bur rtag pa la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur rtag pa la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that does not exist in the permanent.

original: bdag ni rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: The self is not permanent,

original: 'das ma thag pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the previously mentioned errors would ensue.

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not impermanent,

original: rtog pa sngon du mi gtong ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du mi gtong ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fault of not having a prior conception would exist.

original: de bas na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag tu brjod par mi bya ba ma yin nam zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag tu brjod par mi bya ba ma yin nam zhe na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, is it not the case that it should not be said to be either permanent or impermanent?üîΩIt is said:

original: mi rtag brjod bya min gang yin //
analyzed: mi rtag brjod bya min gang yin //
translated: That which is not to be said to be impermanent

original: de ni 'ga' zhig gi rgyu min //
analyzed: de ni 'ga' zhig gi rgyu min //
translated: is not the cause of anything.

original: brjod bya min na nam yang ni //
analyzed: brjod bya min na nam yang ni //
translated: If it is not to be said, then it is never

original: bcing dang grol bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bcing dang grol bar mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: bound or liberated.

original: mi rtag pa brjod par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di la rtag pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa brjod par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di la rtag pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By this statement, ‚ÄúThat which is not to be said to be impermanent,‚Äù the meaning is that it does not exist as permanent.

original: mi rtag pa med na ni rtag pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa med na ni rtag pa ste /
translated: If it is not impermanent, then it is permanent.

original: 'ga' zhig gi yang rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi yang rgyu ma yin te /
translated: It is not the cause of anything.

original: rgyu nyid la mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab par bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu nyid la mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab par bshad do //
translated: It is explained that the very cause is pervaded by impermanence.

original: de bas khyab byed mi rtag pa med na don byed pa med pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: de bas khyab byed mi rtag pa med na don byed pa med pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the pervader, impermanence, does not exist, then because it cannot perform a function, it is not to be said.

original: bcing pa thar par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bcing pa thar par mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible that what is bound is liberated.

original: yang gi sgras brtag pa gcig bu'i skyes bur ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras brtag pa gcig bu'i skyes bur ma zad pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that not only is the person a single investigator.

original: 'on te gnyis ga'i ngo bo nyid can gyi skyes bu yin yang de lta bu'i skyon du 'gyur te gang gi phyir /üîΩgang gi rang bzhin 'jig med pa //
analyzed: 'on te gnyis ga'i ngo bo nyid can gyi skyes bu yin yang de lta bu'i skyon du 'gyur te gang gi phyir / gang gi rang bzhin 'jig med pa //
translated: But even if the person is the nature of both, that error is still committed, because:

original: de la mkhas rnams rtag ces brjod //
analyzed: de la mkhas rnams rtag ces brjod //
translated: The wise call that which has a nature that is not destroyed ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: khrel ba spangs pa'i lta ba 'di //üîΩde phyir de ni rtag ces bshad /
analyzed: khrel ba spangs pa'i lta ba 'di // de phyir de ni rtag ces bshad /
translated: This view, which rejects shamelessness,

original: ces bya ba la /üîΩrtag pa dang / 'jig @376a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba la / rtag pa dang / 'jig @376a * //
translated: is therefore explained as ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: pa ni 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: pa ni 'gal ba ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù and ‚Äúdestroyed‚Äù are contradictory.

original: gang gi rang bzhin 'jig pa med pa de ni mkhas pa rnams kyis rtag pa zhes brjod do //üîΩ'jig pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang / med pa zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin 'jig pa med pa de ni mkhas pa rnams kyis rtag pa zhes brjod do // 'jig pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang / med pa zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: The wise call that which has a nature that is not destroyed ‚Äúpermanent.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúDestroyed,‚Äù ‚Äúnot observed,‚Äù and ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù are synonyms.

original: mi 'jig pa dang rtag pa dang dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jig pa dang rtag pa dang dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs par bshad par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot destroyed,‚Äù ‚Äúpermanent,‚Äù and ‚Äúobserved‚Äù are also synonyms.

original: 'gal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i lta ba can khrel spangs pa de ni rtag pa zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: 'gal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i lta ba can khrel spangs pa de ni rtag pa zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: Because of that contradiction, the one who has abandoned shame, the one who has the view of permanence and impermanence, is called ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: 'di dag gis ni gzhan gyi rtag pa'i thar pa bkag nas 'gog pa'i bden pa gya nom pa'i rnam pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni gzhan gyi rtag pa'i thar pa bkag nas 'gog pa'i bden pa gya nom pa'i rnam pa bstan to //
translated: Having refuted the other‚Äôs permanence of liberation, he teaches the aspect of the truth of cessation as excellent.

original: de ni lam gyi zhar la 'gog pa'i rnam pa bzhi pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de ni lam gyi zhar la 'gog pa'i rnam pa bzhi pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the fourth aspect of cessation as a supplement to the path, he says:

original: bshad zin lam de goms pa las //
analyzed: bshad zin lam de goms pa las //
translated: From cultivating that path that has been explained,

original: rten ni gnas gyur pa yin te //
analyzed: rten ni gnas gyur pa yin te //
translated: the basis is transformed.

original: goms kyang lam bzhin skyon 'byung na //
analyzed: goms kyang lam bzhin skyon 'byung na //
translated: Even if one cultivates it, if faults arise like the path,

original: ma yin nus pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ma yin nus pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: it is not, because it is powerless.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what it says.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The truth of the path has four aspects:

original: lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges pa 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges pa 'byin pa'o //
translated: path, reason, accomplishment, and definite emergence.

original: lam nyid med do zhes rgol ba de la lam yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lam nyid med do zhes rgol ba de la lam yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: To the one who argues, ‚ÄúThe path itself does not exist,‚Äù it is taught, ‚ÄúIt is the path.‚Äù

original: lam 'di ni tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin no zhe na gzhan dag smra bar de bsal ba'i phyir rigs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lam 'di ni tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin no zhe na gzhan dag smra bar de bsal ba'i phyir rigs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This path is not valid, but in order to refute the other's claim, it is called reasoning.

original: mngon sum du byed pa'i lam nyid 'gog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa'i lam nyid 'gog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called practice because it is the cause of the cessation of the path of direct action.

original: de las gzhan pa'i lam bdag tu lta ba yin no zhes smras pa bsal ba'i phyir nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi pa yin no //üîΩde la mngon sum du byed pa'i lam ni grol ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i lam bdag tu lta ba yin no zhes smras pa bsal ba'i phyir nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi pa yin no // de la mngon sum du byed pa'i lam ni grol ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The fourth is called definite release, in order to refute the claim that the path of self view is different from that.

original: rnam pa gsum brjod do //üîΩji ltar sngar bstan pa'i lam de goms pa las sems kyi rgyud dam /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum brjod do // ji ltar sngar bstan pa'i lam de goms pa las sems kyi rgyud dam /
translated: The path of direct action is called the three aspects because it is the cause of liberation.

original: kun gzhi pa yongs su dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid gnas gyur par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun gzhi pa yongs su dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid gnas gyur par 'gyur te /
translated: The path taught above is cultivated, and the continuum of mind or the foundation consciousness becomes the nature of complete purity.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por gyur pa /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por gyur pa /
translated: It becomes the antidote to the self view.

original: bdag med pa goms par gyur na yang nyes pa 'byung ba srid de dper na /
analyzed: bdag med pa goms par gyur na yang nyes pa 'byung ba srid de dper na /
translated: Even when one cultivates selflessness, it is possible for faults to occur, just as

original: skyon dang ldan pa la yon tan 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: skyon dang ldan pa la yon tan 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the arising of good qualities in one who has faults.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, one does not definitely emerge from cyclic existence.

original: nyes pa rnams slar 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams slar 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Faults do not arise again,

original: yon tan rnams dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / skyon rnams dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnams dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / skyon rnams dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because good qualities are the intrinsic reality of things and faults are not the intrinsic reality of things.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It is said:

original: smras pa / rnam shes yul 'dzin pa yi chos //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam shes yul 'dzin pa yi chos //
translated: The nature of consciousness is to apprehend objects.

original: ji ltar de ni yod pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar de ni yod pa bzhin //
translated: It is existent just as it is.

original: 'dzin gyur yod pa'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: 'dzin gyur yod pa'i bdag nyid de //
translated: It is the nature of existence when it is apprehended.

original: de yis skyed par byed pa'ang yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yis skyed par byed pa'ang yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is also that which causes generation.

original: srog @376b chags rnams lam la 'jug par byed pa rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: srog @376b chags rnams lam la 'jug par byed pa rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: Here, consciousness is that which causes living beings to engage in the path.

original: de'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid ni yul 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid ni yul 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The nature of its reality is to apprehend objects.

original: yul nyams su myong ba rnam par shes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yul nyams su myong ba rnam par shes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Consciousness arises from the experience of objects.

original: myong ba med na ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: myong ba med na ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is no experience, there is no consciousness.

original: yul ji ltar yod pa bzhin du 'dzin la /
analyzed: yul ji ltar yod pa bzhin du 'dzin la /
translated: It apprehends the object just as it exists,

original: rnam pa gzhan du 'dzin pa ni ma yin te 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du 'dzin pa ni ma yin te 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and not in some other way, because otherwise it would be erroneous.

original: yul de yang yod par 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par shes pa ni skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yul de yang yod par 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par shes pa ni skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: And that object is the cause that generates consciousness in the form of the appearance of an existent entity.

original: rnam pa gtod par byed nus pa'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gtod par byed nus pa'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa'i yul yin no //
translated: The object of consciousness is the cause that is able to project an image.

original: de bas na rang gi ngo bo rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi ngo bo rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'i chos te /
translated: Therefore, the nature of consciousness is to be aware of itself,

original: yod par gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa nyid yul yin no //
analyzed: yod par gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa nyid yul yin no //
translated: and the object is just the awareness of an existent entity.

original: de'i phyir mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can yul te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can yul te /
translated: Therefore, the object has the nature of impermanence, selflessness, and so on,

original: rnam par shes pa ni yul de 'dzin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yul de 'dzin pa nyid yin no //
translated: and consciousness is the apprehension of that object.

original: gal te mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa shes pa'i chos yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa shes pa'i chos yin na /
translated: If the apprehension of impermanence, selflessness, and so on is the nature of consciousness,

original: de'i tshe rtag pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtag pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: then would it not follow that it would not apprehend permanence and self?

original: de bas na de'i rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral na 'khor bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na de'i rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral na 'khor bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if one is free from attachment and so on, which have that as their root, one will not cycle.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: de yi ngo bo nyid 'di las //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo nyid 'di las //
translated: From the nature of that,

original: rgyu gzhan gyis ni 'khrul par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gyis ni 'khrul par 'gyur //
translated: There is error due to another cause.

original: ldog pa nyid ni rkyen la ltos //
analyzed: ldog pa nyid ni rkyen la ltos //
translated: Cessation itself depends on conditions,

original: mi brtan sbrul gyi blo bzhin no//üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi brtan sbrul gyi blo bzhin no// zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like the thought of an unstable snake.

original: bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa rig pa de'i ngo bo nyid de /üîΩrang bzhin rnam par shes pa 'di las te /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa rig pa de'i ngo bo nyid de / rang bzhin rnam par shes pa 'di las te /
translated: Here, the nature of that is the knowledge of selflessness and so on.

original: bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa 'di las sems de 'khrul par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa 'di las sems de 'khrul par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: From this consciousness, which is the nature of that, the mind is made to err due to another cause, which is similar to and arises from this apprehender of the nature of selflessness.

original: 'o na gal te bdag med pa 'dzin pa las sems 'khrul par byed pa de'i tshe dus gzhan du yang sems 'khrul par 'gyur ba'i phyir rtag tu 'khor bar 'gyur gyi thar pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te bdag med pa 'dzin pa las sems 'khrul par byed pa de'i tshe dus gzhan du yang sems 'khrul par 'gyur ba'i phyir rtag tu 'khor bar 'gyur gyi thar pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Well, if the mind is made to err from apprehending selflessness, then at that time, since the mind would be made to err at another time as well, it would always cycle and there would be no liberation.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gi phyir 'khrul pa slar ldog pa rkyen gcig la ltos pas rtsa ba med pa can yin pa'i phyir dus thams cad du gnas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khrul pa slar ldog pa rkyen gcig la ltos pas rtsa ba med pa can yin pa'i phyir dus thams cad du gnas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Because the reversal of error depends on a single condition, it is without a root, and therefore it does not endure at all times.

original: sbrul gyi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: sbrul gyi blo bzhin no //
translated: It is like the idea of a snake.

original: ji ltar rtag pa nyid dang / bdag dang bcas pa med pa de ltar sngar bstan zhing 'og kyang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa nyid dang / bdag dang bcas pa med pa de ltar sngar bstan zhing 'og kyang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is without permanence and without a self, so it was taught above and will be taught below.

original: de bas na nang gi ma rig pas bslad pa las byung ba'i dri ma ni glo bur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nang gi ma rig pas bslad pa las byung ba'i dri ma ni glo bur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the stain that arises from the defilement of inner ignorance is adventitious.

original: de smras pa /
analyzed: de smras pa /
translated: He says that:

original: sems 'di'i rang bzhin 'od gsal te //
analyzed: sems 'di'i rang bzhin 'od gsal te //
translated: The nature of this mind is clear light.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩshes pas @377a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / shes pas @377a * //
translated: Here,

original: rtag pa dang bral bar 'dzin pa'i phyir sems ni ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang bral bar 'dzin pa'i phyir sems ni ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: because consciousness is grasped as being free from permanence, the mind is pure by nature.

original: dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The stains are adventitious.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i sgro 'dogs pa'i rtsa ba med pa can gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i sgro 'dogs pa'i rtsa ba med pa can gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the root of the superimposition of existence is nonexistent, there is no entity.

original: dngos po la rtag pa ni gang du yang snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la rtag pa ni gang du yang snang ba ma yin no //
translated: Permanence in things is not seen anywhere.

original: brtags pas stong pa de'i phyir dri ma rnams ni glo bur pa yin no //
analyzed: brtags pas stong pa de'i phyir dri ma rnams ni glo bur pa yin no //
translated: Since they are empty of being imputed, therefore the stains are adventitious.

original: de phyir sngar nus med pa yang //üîΩphyis de rang bzhin la ci nus //
analyzed: de phyir sngar nus med pa yang // phyis de rang bzhin la ci nus //
translated: Therefore, even if previously powerless,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: what power could they have later in the essence?

original: de'i phyir sngar thos pa dang / bsams pa'i dus su de kho na nyid mthong ba la gags byed pa'i nus pa med na phyis lam mngon du byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar thos pa dang / bsams pa'i dus su de kho na nyid mthong ba la gags byed pa'i nus pa med na phyis lam mngon du byed pa'i tshe /
translated: Here, therefore, if previously, at the time of hearing and contemplating, they are powerless to obstruct seeing thatness, then later, when the path is manifested,

original: sems kyi rgyud lam gyi ngo bo nyid du gyur na /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud lam gyi ngo bo nyid du gyur na /
translated: if the continuum of mind becomes the essence of the path,

original: nyes pa rnams la skye ba'i nus pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams la skye ba'i nus pa lta ga la yod /
translated: how could faults have the power to arise?

original: dad pa la sogs pa dman pa dgra bcom par gyur pa yang 'dod chags dang bral ba las nyams par gyur nas lam mngon du byed par 'gyur ba dang / yul nye bar gyur pa las nyon mongs pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dman pa dgra bcom par gyur pa yang 'dod chags dang bral ba las nyams par gyur nas lam mngon du byed par 'gyur ba dang / yul nye bar gyur pa las nyon mongs pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Even those with inferior qualities such as faith who become arhats could lose their freedom from attachment and then manifest the path, and the afflictions would engage due to the presence of objects.

original: de bas na ji ltar nyon mongs pa slar mi skye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar nyon mongs pa slar mi skye ba yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how is it that the afflictions do not arise again?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / nus pa yod na'ang gnod pa can //
analyzed: smras pa / nus pa yod na'ang gnod pa can //
translated: Even if there is the potential, there is no harm

original: skyes nus snying po can dngos la //
analyzed: skyes nus snying po can dngos la //
translated: In the production of the essence of the potential.

original: ldog par skyed nus yod min te //
analyzed: ldog par skyed nus yod min te //
translated: There is no potential for the production of the reversal

original: 'dam gyi nang gi me bzhin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dam gyi nang gi me bzhin no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like fire in wet tinder.

original: gal te yang dad pa dman pa la sogs pa'i dgra bcom pa la skyon rnams skye na yang nang du gyur pa'i gnod pa can skyed nus pa can gyi rgyud la skyon gyi tshogs rnams shin tu skyed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang dad pa dman pa la sogs pa'i dgra bcom pa la skyon rnams skye na yang nang du gyur pa'i gnod pa can skyed nus pa can gyi rgyud la skyon gyi tshogs rnams shin tu skyed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: If the arhats of weak faith, etc., produce faults, the collection of faults is not able to be produced in the continuum of those who have the potential to produce the internal harm.

original: dper na sa gzhi 'dam bur gyur pa la me skyed pa'i nus pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa gzhi 'dam bur gyur pa la me skyed pa'i nus pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the absence of the potential to produce fire in wet tinder.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / 'tshe ba med la yang dag don //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'tshe ba med la yang dag don //
translated: In the absence of harm, the true meaning

original: ngo bo nyid la phyin log gis //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la phyin log gis //
translated: Is not grasped by the inversion of the nature.

original: brtson dang ldan yang gnod med de //
analyzed: brtson dang ldan yang gnod med de //
translated: Even if one is diligent, there is no harm

original: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the mind grasps that side.

original: ngo bo nyid ni brtson pa med par bzlog par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni brtson pa med par bzlog par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of things cannot be reversed without effort.

original: gang zhig gis skyon mthong nas yon tan la 'jug par byed cing yon tan mthong nas skyon la 'jug par mi byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig gis skyon mthong nas yon tan la 'jug par byed cing yon tan mthong nas skyon la 'jug par mi byed de /
translated: One who sees faults and engages in virtues, and who sees virtues and does not engage in faults,

original: lam la goms pa can ni yon tan mthong nas skyon la mi 'jug cing /
analyzed: lam la goms pa can ni yon tan mthong nas skyon la mi 'jug cing /
translated: one who is accustomed to the path sees virtues and does not engage in faults.

original: skyon mthong nas yon tan la ldog par mi byed de /
analyzed: skyon mthong nas yon tan la ldog par mi byed de /
translated: One who sees faults does not reverse from virtues.

original: lam gyi yon tan rnams ni 'tshe ba med pa can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lam gyi yon tan rnams ni 'tshe ba med pa can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The path is endowed with the virtue of nonviolence,

original: skyon thams cad dang bral pa'i phyir dang / rab tu zhi ba'i bde ba las mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon thams cad dang bral pa'i phyir dang / rab tu zhi ba'i bde ba las mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is free from all faults and because it does not change from the bliss of peace.

original: 'tshe ba med pa'i lam ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa'i lam ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The path is the nature of wisdom.

original: @377b ngo bo nyid ni bzlog par mi nus te /
analyzed: @377b ngo bo nyid ni bzlog par mi nus te /
translated: The nature of things cannot be reversed.

original: shes pa nyid kyang med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa nyid kyang med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it would follow that consciousness itself would not exist.

original: lam ni bden pa'i yul can de bas na /
analyzed: lam ni bden pa'i yul can de bas na /
translated: The path has the object of the truth.

original: yul gnas bzhin du ji ltar lam ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: yul gnas bzhin du ji ltar lam ldog par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the path be reversed while abiding in the object?

original: de'i 'tshe ba med pa ni yang dag pa'i don dang ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'tshe ba med pa ni yang dag pa'i don dang ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Its non-violence is the reality and the nature of things.

original: de ni phyin ci ldog gi skyon gyis bzlog bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyin ci ldog gi skyon gyis bzlog bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It cannot be turned back by the fault of error.

original: gzhan yang sems de'i phyogs 'dzin pa ni skyon la 'jug pa ma yin te de bas na skyon gyi don du brtson pa la 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems de'i phyogs 'dzin pa ni skyon la 'jug pa ma yin te de bas na skyon gyi don du brtson pa la 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the mind that takes up its side does not engage in faults, so it does not engage in striving for the sake of faults.

original: dngos po ma lus pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su 'jal bar nus pa can ni yon tan de'i phyogs 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po ma lus pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su 'jal bar nus pa can ni yon tan de'i phyogs 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is able to fully comprehend the nature of all things, it takes up the side of its virtues.

original: 'bad par byas kyang lam la gnod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bad par byas kyang lam la gnod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though it strives, it does not harm the path.

original: 'di dag gis ni lam zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni lam zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: By these, the nature of the so-called path is taught.

original: 'o na 'dod chags kyang zhe sdang dag 'gal ba'i rnam pa can du gyur ba yang gcig kho na la gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na 'dod chags kyang zhe sdang dag 'gal ba'i rnam pa can du gyur ba yang gcig kho na la gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: Well then, since attachment and aversion are also contradictory in their aspects, they do not harm a single thing.

original: gnod par byed pa'i 'dod chags la yang zhe sdang gis gnod par byed pa mthong ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du 'dod chags kyang zhe sdang la slar gnod pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i 'dod chags la yang zhe sdang gis gnod par byed pa mthong ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du 'dod chags kyang zhe sdang la slar gnod pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, one sees that anger harms attachment that harms, and likewise, one sees that attachment harms anger.

original: de ltar bdag dang / bdag med pa mthong ba dag kyang phan tshun gnod pa byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang / bdag med pa mthong ba dag kyang phan tshun gnod pa byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: But don‚Äôt the views of self and selflessness harm each other?

original: de bas na lam ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba thob par byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na lam ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba thob par byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the path does not cause one to attain freedom from the afflictions.

original: smras pa ni /
analyzed: smras pa ni /
translated: We reply:

original: bdag 'dzin rgyu gcig can nyid dad //
analyzed: bdag 'dzin rgyu gcig can nyid dad //
translated: They have the same cause of self-grasping.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Because they are cause and effect,

original: 'dod chags khong khro dag phan tshun //üîΩtha dad na yang gnod pa med //
analyzed: 'dod chags khong khro dag phan tshun // tha dad na yang gnod pa med //
translated: Attachment and anger

original: ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te /
translated: Do not harm each other, even if they are different.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Attachment and anger have the same cause of self-grasping.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa yod na gcig kyang gtan du chags par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa yod na gcig kyang gtan du chags par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If self-grasping exists, one will not be permanently attached to anything.

original: phan tshun 'gal bar gyur pa yin yang rim par skye ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal bar gyur pa yin yang rim par skye ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though they are mutually contradictory, they arise in sequence.

original: gzhan yang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dag phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dag phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, desire and hatred are mutually the cause and effect of each other.

original: 'gal ba yin yang gnod par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'gal ba yin yang gnod par mi byed do //
translated: Even though they are contradictory, they do not harm each other.

original: 'di ltar gang dag la khro ba dang 'brel pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu de ni gdon mi za bar bde bar 'dod de //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag la khro ba dang 'brel pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu de ni gdon mi za bar bde bar 'dod de //
translated: Thus, those who are related to the cause of suffering that is associated with anger certainly desire happiness.

original: de bas na de dag rgyu dang 'brel ba yin gyi bde ba'i rgyu nye bar blangs pa na gdon mi za bar gzhan la gnod pa dang / khro ba dang / 'brel pa can yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de dag rgyu dang 'brel ba yin gyi bde ba'i rgyu nye bar blangs pa na gdon mi za bar gzhan la gnod pa dang / khro ba dang / 'brel pa can yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are related to the cause. When they take up the cause of happiness, they certainly are related to the harm of others and to anger.

original: de bas na 'dod chags ni khro ba skyed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags ni khro ba skyed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, desire is the cause of anger.

original: bdag med pa mthong ba ni thams cad du bdag tu 'dzin pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir /üîΩ'gog pa @378a * //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba ni thams cad du bdag tu 'dzin pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir / 'gog pa @378a * //
translated: The vision of no-self is always in conflict with the grasping of self.

original: thob par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: thob par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it causes the attainment of cessation.

original: byams pa la sogs pa zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gnyen por dam pa'i chos nas gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gnyen por dam pa'i chos nas gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not love and so on taught in the excellent Dharma as antidotes to hatred and so on?

original: de'i phyir / ji ltar bdag med pa mthong ba kho na lam du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir / ji ltar bdag med pa mthong ba kho na lam du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how can seeing selflessness alone be the path?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: byams pa sogs dang 'gal med phyir //
analyzed: byams pa sogs dang 'gal med phyir //
translated: Because they are not incompatible with love and so on,

original: shin tu nyes pa tshar gcod phyir //
analyzed: shin tu nyes pa tshar gcod phyir //
translated: because they completely eradicate faults,

original: nyes kun de yi rtsa ba can //üîΩde yang 'jig tshogs lta ba yin /
analyzed: nyes kun de yi rtsa ba can // de yang 'jig tshogs lta ba yin /
translated: and because all faults have that as their root,

original: zhes bya ba yin te /üîΩgal te yang zhe sdang gi gnyen po byams pa dang / 'dod chags kyi gnyen po mi sdug pa dang / 'tshe ba'i gnyen po snying rje dang / phrag dog gi gnyen po dga' ba dang / thams cad kyi gnyen po btang snyoms yin pa de lta na yang byams pa la sogs pa las shin tu nyes pa rnams tshar gcod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te / gal te yang zhe sdang gi gnyen po byams pa dang / 'dod chags kyi gnyen po mi sdug pa dang / 'tshe ba'i gnyen po snying rje dang / phrag dog gi gnyen po dga' ba dang / thams cad kyi gnyen po btang snyoms yin pa de lta na yang byams pa la sogs pa las shin tu nyes pa rnams tshar gcod pa ma yin te /
translated: that is the view of the transitory collection.

original: gti mug dang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug dang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though love is the antidote to hatred, the unattractive is the antidote to attachment, compassion is the antidote to violence, joy is the antidote to jealousy, and equanimity is the antidote to all, still faults are not completely eradicated by love and so on because they are not incompatible with delusion.

original: gti mug yod kyang nga rgyal med pa las nyes pa thams cad spong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gti mug yod kyang nga rgyal med pa las nyes pa thams cad spong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that all faults are abandoned when one has ignorance but not pride?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad gti mug gi rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad gti mug gi rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the afflictions such as attachment are rooted in ignorance.

original: gti mug de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste /
analyzed: gti mug de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste /
translated: Moreover, that ignorance is the afflicted view of the self,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi gti mug ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi gti mug ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because afflicted ignorance is the afflicted view of the self.

original: dgra bcom pa'i mi shes pa gang yin ba de ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i mi shes pa gang yin ba de ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The nonafflicted ignorance of arhats

original: de dag gti mug las kyang grol ba ste /
analyzed: de dag gti mug las kyang grol ba ste /
translated: is also liberated from ignorance,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta na ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro // de lta na ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: because it is free from the afflicted view of the self.

original: shes par ma gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid can ma rig pa yin la /
analyzed: shes par ma gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid can ma rig pa yin la /
translated: That is so, but ignorance is the reality that is not known.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni shes pa'i ngo bo nyid can yin na /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni shes pa'i ngo bo nyid can yin na /
translated: The afflicted view of the self is the reality that is known.

original: de ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: How can the afflicted view of the self be ignorance?

original: smras pa ni /
analyzed: smras pa ni /
translated: He says:

original: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs nyid dang / sems byung nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs nyid dang / sems byung nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the counteragent to knowledge is observed, and because mental factors are observed,

original: log par dmigs pa mi shes pa'o //üîΩgsungs phyir gzhan ni rigs ldan min //
analyzed: log par dmigs pa mi shes pa'o // gsungs phyir gzhan ni rigs ldan min //
translated: ignorance is the non-understanding of the wrongly observed.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is said, the other is not endowed with a lineage.

original: gal te mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid ma rig pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid ma rig pa yin na /
translated: Here, if the nature of non-clarity is ignorance,

original: gzugs la sogs pa log pa yang ma rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa log pa yang ma rig par 'gyur te /
translated: then the non-existence of form, etc. would also be ignorance.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las de las lhag pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las de las lhag pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is more excellent than form, etc.?

original: de bas mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang ma rig par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'o na te mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang ma rig par 'gyur ro // 'o na te mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, nirvana and the attainment of cessation would also be ignorance.

original: ma @378b rig pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma @378b rig pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say: Nirvana is not ignorance because it is not the cause of affliction,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: ma rig pa mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid can ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid can ma yin te /
translated: Because the nature of ignorance is not characterized by non-clarity.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa ste /
translated: The afflicted view of the self is ignorance because it is the cause of affliction.

original: rig pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar yang chos gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can yin gyi /
analyzed: rig pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar yang chos gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can yin gyi /
translated: Because it contradicts reason.

original: de med pa tsam ni chos ma yin pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de med pa tsam ni chos ma yin pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, it is not that the mere absence of that is not a phenomenon,

original: de las gzhan pa tsam yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa tsam yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it merely something other than that.

original: 'on kyang rjes su mthun pa dang 'gal ba la gnod pa ni chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su mthun pa dang 'gal ba la gnod pa ni chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: However, that which is incompatible with what is suitable and what is compatible is not a phenomenon.

original: de bzhin du bden pa'i don gsal bar med pa tsam ni brdzun pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du bden pa'i don gsal bar med pa tsam ni brdzun pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, the mere absence of the manifestation of the meaning of truth is not a lie.

original: 'on kyang med pa ston pa ni brdzun gyi tshig yin no ;
analyzed: 'on kyang med pa ston pa ni brdzun gyi tshig yin no ;
translated: However, the statement of that absence is a lie.üîΩIf that is so, then even if an entity exists, when one is confused and realizes it to be nonexistent, and one states that it is nonexistent, at that time it is not true.

original: ; de lta na ni dngos po yod pa nyid du gyur kyang gang gi tshe 'khrul nas med pa nyid du rtogs par gyur pas med pa'o zhes ston par byed pa de'i tshe bden pa nyid ma yin ba dang / dngos po med pa yang yod pa nyid du rtogs nas yod ces ston par byed pa de'i tshe brdzun du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ; de lta na ni dngos po yod pa nyid du gyur kyang gang gi tshe 'khrul nas med pa nyid du rtogs par gyur pas med pa'o zhes ston par byed pa de'i tshe bden pa nyid ma yin ba dang / dngos po med pa yang yod pa nyid du rtogs nas yod ces ston par byed pa de'i tshe brdzun du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: And when one realizes that a nonexistent entity exists and states that it exists, at that time is that not a lie?

original: de ni ma yin te smra ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul can te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te smra ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul can te /
translated: That is not so, because speech is the domain of conceptual thought.

original: phyi rol ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not reveal external reality.

original: des na dngos po gang zhig ji ltar shes pa de de bzhin du ston pa ni brdzun ma yin te /
analyzed: des na dngos po gang zhig ji ltar shes pa de de bzhin du ston pa ni brdzun ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, if one teaches something as it is known, that is not false.

original: phyin ci log gi tshig ni brdzun yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi tshig ni brdzun yin no //
translated: False is the statement that is erroneous.

original: de bzhin du rig pa dang 'gal ba gzhan ni ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rig pa dang 'gal ba gzhan ni ma rig pa ste /
translated: Similarly, ignorance is the opposite of knowledge.

original: de nyid nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the afflictions.

original: mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i stong pa nyid ji ltar gang zhig gi rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i stong pa nyid ji ltar gang zhig gi rgyur 'gyur /
translated: How can emptiness, which is nonappearance, be its cause?

original: ma rig pa gtan med pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ma rig pa gtan med pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Ignorance is not utterly nonexistent,

original: yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: but neither does it exist.

original: 'on kyang log pa dang sgyu mar snang ba ste nyon mongs pa yang log pa dang sgyu mar snang ba nyid yin nam /
analyzed: 'on kyang log pa dang sgyu mar snang ba ste nyon mongs pa yang log pa dang sgyu mar snang ba nyid yin nam /
translated: However, it is a false, illusory appearance. Are the afflictions also false, illusory appearances?

original: des na skyon 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: des na skyon 'di med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, this error does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: ma rig pa yod pa ma yin //
analyzed: ma rig pa yod pa ma yin //
translated: Ignorance does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba ci gsal ba med pa la brjod dam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ci gsal ba med pa la brjod dam /
translated: Does this refer to the absence of clarity?

original: phyin ci log tu dmigs pa yin de la gal te phyogs dang po yin na de'i tshe su la yang rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu dmigs pa yin de la gal te phyogs dang po yin na de'i tshe su la yang rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: If the first position is accepted, then since no one has understanding,

original: 'gro ba long ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba long ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: the world would be blind.

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa len na /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa len na /
translated: But if the second position is accepted,

original: de lta na yang phyin ci log tu dmigs pa'i mi shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang phyin ci log tu dmigs pa'i mi shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then since it is a non-ascertainment that is a mistaken perception,

original: ji ltar ma rig pa dngos po med par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar ma rig pa dngos po med par 'gyur /
translated: how could ignorance be a non-thing?

original: rig pa yod par myong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rig pa yod par myong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it experienced as a thing?

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /

original: de gtan med na ni dbu ma'i lta ba khas blangs par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te ma rig pa las snang ba gang yin pa'i gzung ba @379a * //
analyzed: de gtan med na ni dbu ma'i lta ba khas blangs par 'gyur ro // 'on te ma rig pa las snang ba gang yin pa'i gzung ba @379a * //

original: de ni brdzun pa'i phyir de med pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ni brdzun pa'i phyir de med pa'o zhe na /

analyzed: 'o na gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba ji ltar med pa yin /

analyzed: de ltar na 'o na ni log pa'i shes pa snang ba gang yin pa'i gzung ba de yod na ji ltar ma rig par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then if the apprehended object that appears in a mistaken consciousness exists, how could it be ignorance?

original: rtag pa la sogs par rtogs pa shes pa las log pa gzung bar snad ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs par rtogs pa shes pa las log pa gzung bar snad ba ma yin te /

original: 'on kyang gang snad ba de thams cad dang rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang snad ba de thams cad dang rig pa'o //

original: de la 'khrul pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa ni ma yin te /

original: tshangs pa yang 'khrul pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa yang 'khrul pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: de bas na ma rig pa shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na ma rig pa shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Therefore, it is the nature of the knowledge of non-knowledge.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de skad ces tha snyad btags so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de skad ces tha snyad btags so //

original: sems las byung ba nyid kyi yang phyir dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba nyid kyi yang phyir dmigs pa ste /

original: ma rig pa ni log par dmigs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni log par dmigs pa dag yin no //

original: rten dang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / rdzas dang / dus rnams mtshungs pas mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi rnam pa las phyin ci log tu ba rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / rdzas dang / dus rnams mtshungs pas mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi rnam pa las phyin ci log tu ba rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The nature of ignorance is the opposite of the aspect of wisdom.üîΩAnd because it is said:

analyzed: zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir dang / de la mi shes pa dang bral ba gang zhe na /

original: ji ltar gyur ba'i chos rnams la sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gyur ba'i chos rnams la sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du gang su dag 'jig rten pas nye bar btags pa'i rig pa de dag thams cad bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'gyur te /

analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba ni ma yin no zhes kyang gsungs pa'i phyir log par dmigs pa ni mi shes pa'o//

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma rig pa'i phyogs gcig ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma rig pa'i phyogs gcig ma yin nam /

original: ma rig pa yang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid can yin na /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid can yin na /
translated: Also, ignorance is the universal mental affliction that has the nature of nonclarity.

original: de ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta bar brjod de /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta bar brjod de /
translated: How can it be called the afflicted view of the self?

original: khyad par gyi sgra'i yul spyi ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgra'i yul spyi ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a universal that is the object of the term ‚Äúspecific.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gal te ma rig pa lta ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te ma rig pa lta ba nyid yin na /
translated: Similarly, if ignorance is a view,

original: de'i tshe ma rig pa ni lta ba dang mtshungs pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba mtshungs par ldan pa'i don du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ma rig pa ni lta ba dang mtshungs pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba mtshungs par ldan pa'i don du mi 'gyur te /

original: ldan pa ni tha dad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ldan pa ni tha dad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because being concomitant is the cause of being different.

original: 'dir smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ni /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'gal ba gang yin 'dir bshad bya //
analyzed: 'gal ba gang yin 'dir bshad bya //
translated: We will explain here what is contradictory.

original: stong nyid mthong dang de 'gal phyir //
analyzed: stong nyid mthong dang de 'gal phyir //
translated: Because it is contradictory to see emptiness,

original: de yi bdag nyid skyon @379b kun dang // 'gal bar rab tu grub pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yi bdag nyid skyon @379b kun dang // 'gal bar rab tu grub pa yin // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: it is well established that it is contradictory to the self and all faults.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa nyid ni spyi dang khyad par tha dad par brtags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa nyid ni spyi dang khyad par tha dad par brtags pa ma yin te /
translated: Concomitance is not imagined to be a universal or a specific.

original: dper na nags pa la sha dang ldan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na nags pa la sha dang ldan pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like saying ‚Äúpossessing meat‚Äù in the case of a hunter.

original: dngos su na pa la sha'i ngo bo nyid kho nar brjod do //
analyzed: dngos su na pa la sha'i ngo bo nyid kho nar brjod do //
translated: In fact, it is only the nature of meat that is referred to.

original: de bzhin du khyad par gyi sgras kyang de'i ngo bo nyid ma rig pa gleng gzhir gyur pa'i gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par gyi sgras kyang de'i ngo bo nyid ma rig pa gleng gzhir gyur pa'i gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, the word ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù also refers to the nature of that, which is ignorance, as the primary subject matter.

original: lta ba dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa'i zhes bya ba la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: lta ba dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa'i zhes bya ba la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in saying ‚Äúthe ignorance that is associated with views.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir bdag tu lta ba ma rig pa yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag tu lta ba ma rig pa yin pas /
translated: Because the view of self is ignorance,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad de'i rtsa ba can te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad de'i rtsa ba can te /

original: des na bdag med pa mthong ba de dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na bdag med pa mthong ba de dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the view of self is incompatible with seeing selflessness,

original: de'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid de /
translated: it is the nature of that.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu can nyon mongs pa dang / stong pa nyid mthong ba 'gal ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu can nyon mongs pa dang / stong pa nyid mthong ba 'gal ba grub pa yin no //
translated: It is established that the afflictions, which are caused by the view of self, are incompatible with seeing emptiness.

original: de bas na gti mug 'gags na 'khor ba ma lus pa 'gag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na gti mug 'gags na 'khor ba ma lus pa 'gag pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because when delusion ceases, all of sa·πÉsƒÅra ceases,

original: des par 'byung ba'i rnam pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: des par 'byung ba'i rnam pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: it is said to be the aspect of definite emergence.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams srog chags kyi chos yin pa'i phyir zad par mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams srog chags kyi chos yin pa'i phyir zad par mi rigs te /
translated: Attachment and so on are not exhausted because they are the nature of living beings,

original: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin ma yin nam zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin ma yin nam zhe na smras pa /
translated: just like form and so on, is it not?

original: zad min srog chags chos nyid phyir //
analyzed: zad min srog chags chos nyid phyir //
translated: Reply: They are not exhausted because they are the nature of living beings,

original: gzugs sogs bzhin no ma grub phyir //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bzhin no ma grub phyir //

original: gnyen po'i phyogs dang 'brel yod na //üîΩspong ba dag kyang mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs dang 'brel yod na // spong ba dag kyang mthong phyir ro //
translated: If they were related to the antidote,

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams srog chags kyi ngo bo nyid kyi chos yin pa'i phyir zad par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ma yin te /

translated: then their abandonment would also be seen.üîΩAttachment and so on are not exhausted because they are the nature of living beings, just like form and so on.

original: srog chags kyi chos su de nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog chags kyi chos su de nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not established that they are the nature of living beings.

original: srog chags 'ba' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: srog chags 'ba' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Not only is a living being not existent,

original: 'on kyang skad cig ma brgyud pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang skad cig ma brgyud pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: but it is also taught that it is a continuum of moments.

original: gzhan yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yod na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yod na /
translated: Moreover, if there is a connection with the cultivation of the unlovely, etc., which are the antidotes to desire, etc.,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa spong ba mthong ba yod de /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa spong ba mthong ba yod de /
translated: then there is the vision of the abandonment of desire, etc.

original: de'i phyir mi zad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi zad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not inexhaustible.

original: de dag gis ni 'gog pa'i bshad pa bsdus nas bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'gog pa'i bshad pa bsdus nas bstan to //
translated: They have summarized and taught the explanation of cessation.

original: 'o na gser zhu bar gyur ba yang brtas na sra bar gyur pa de bzhin du bdag med par mthong ba skyes kyang slar 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gser zhu bar gyur ba yang brtas na sra bar gyur pa de bzhin du bdag med par mthong ba skyes kyang slar 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Now, if the melted gold is heated again, it becomes solid. In the same way, even though the vision of selflessness has arisen, desire, etc. will arise again.üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / sra ba bzhin du'ang skye min te //
analyzed: smras pa / sra ba bzhin du'ang skye min te //
translated: It does not arise again like solidity.

original: nyes pa dag ni 'gal can gyi //
analyzed: nyes pa dag ni 'gal can gyi //
translated: The faults are contradictory.

original: de yi bdag nyid ldog med dang // ma nges phyir na thal ba bzhin //
analyzed: de yi bdag nyid ldog med dang // ma nges phyir na thal ba bzhin //
translated: Since they are not stopped in their nature, and are uncertain, it is like the consequence.

original: @380a * // zhes bya ba la lam mngon du byed pa dang 'gal ba can gyi nyes pa rnams gser gyi sra ba bzhin du slar skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: @380a * // zhes bya ba la lam mngon du byed pa dang 'gal ba can gyi nyes pa rnams gser gyi sra ba bzhin du slar skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The faults that are contradictory to the actualization of the path do not arise again like the solidity of gold.

original: bdag med pa mthong ba'i las la goms pa mi 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba'i las la goms pa mi 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity of seeing selflessness is not subject to fear.

original: gnyen po yod par gyur na nyes pa 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gnyen po yod par gyur na nyes pa 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: When the antidote is present, the fault does not occur.

original: 'di thal ba yis kyang ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di thal ba yis kyang ma nges pa yin te /
translated: This is also inconclusive because of the following example.

original: 'di ltar me'i stobs kyis thal bar gyur pa slar shin tu ldog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar me'i stobs kyis thal bar gyur pa slar shin tu ldog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The power of fire is such that it turns ashes to dust, but it does not do so to the same degree.

analyzed: de bzhin du lam gyi nyon mongs pa log pa ni slar nye bar skye ba ma yin no //

analyzed: de dag gis ni lam bshad pa bsdus te bstan to //

original: bdag bsgoms pas kyang thar par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag bsgoms pas kyang thar par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /

original: bdag med pa mthong ba de yis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba de yis ci zhig bya /

original: de ltar lung las kyang bdag tu bsam par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar lung las kyang bdag tu bsam par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, the scriptures also say that one should contemplate the self.

original: de bas na lam ni nges par 'byin pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na lam ni nges par 'byin pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the path is not the means of liberation.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gang zhig nga zhes bdag lta ba //
analyzed: gang zhig nga zhes bdag lta ba //
translated: One who views the self as ‚ÄúI‚Äù

original: de la rtag pa nyid du chags //
analyzed: de la rtag pa nyid du chags //
translated: is attached to the self as permanent.

original: chags pas de la sred 'gyur zhing //üîΩsred pa skyon rnams sel bar byed //
analyzed: chags pas de la sred 'gyur zhing // sred pa skyon rnams sel bar byed //
translated: One who is attached to it becomes desirous of it.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Desire is the cause of the removal of faults.

original: bdag tu lta ba can ni mi za bar bdag rtag par chags pas bcing bar 'gyur to /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba can ni mi za bar bdag rtag par chags pas bcing bar 'gyur to /
translated: One who has the view of self, not eating, becomes bound by attachment to the self as permanent.

original: chags pas bde ba la sred pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chags pas bde ba la sred pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //

original: gang gis gang la chags pa de ni bde ba la 'dod pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis gang la chags pa de ni bde ba la 'dod pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is attached to something becomes desirous of pleasure in it.

analyzed: bdag tu lta ba can yin yang chags pa yod do zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin nam /

analyzed: shing mthong yang shing la chags pa med pa dang / bud med mthong ba tsam gyis kyang de la chags par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: gang gis bdag mthong ba de la chags pa yod do zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis bdag mthong ba de la chags pa yod do zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that one who sees the self has attachment.

original: 'o na gal te bdag tu lta ba la chags pa med pa na gang la yang chags pa nyid med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te bdag tu lta ba la chags pa med pa na gang la yang chags pa nyid med par 'gyur te /
translated: If one who has the view of self has no attachment, then no one would have attachment at all.

original: rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other cause.

original: shing la yang bdag phan 'dogs par ma mthong ba'i phyir chags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing la yang bdag phan 'dogs par ma mthong ba'i phyir chags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And you do not see a tree as helpful to you, so you do not become attached to it.

original: gang la bdag la phan 'dogs pa can du chags pa de ji ltar bdag la chags pa med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang la bdag la phan 'dogs pa can du chags pa de ji ltar bdag la chags pa med par 'gyur na /
translated: If you are attached to what is helpful to you, how can you be without attachment to yourself?

original: 'on te chags pa'i khyad par las bdag la chags pa med la gzhan la chags pa yon tan che ba las snying rjes chags so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te chags pa'i khyad par las bdag la chags pa med la gzhan la chags pa yon tan che ba las snying rjes chags so zhe na /

original: gang gzhan la chags pa yod pa de la bdag la yang chags par ci ste mi @380b 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gzhan la chags pa yod pa de la bdag la yang chags par ci ste mi @380b 'gyur /

original: 'di ltar bdag la chags par snang ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag la chags par snang ba nyid ma yin nam /

analyzed: bdag la chags pa med na gzhan la chags par mi 'thad do //
translated: If you are not attached to yourself, it is not tenable that you are attached to others.

original: gzhan yang yon tan can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang yon tan can zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, if you are called ‚Äúvirtuous‚ÄùüîΩbecause you help others, then you are not acting out of compassion,

original: gal te gzhan dag la phan 'dogs pa yin na de'i tshe rtog pa sngon du ma btang ba ste /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag la phan 'dogs pa yin na de'i tshe rtog pa sngon du ma btang ba ste /
translated: but out of a previous decision.

original: bdag yongs su btang nas gzhan la phan par byed pa ni shin tu dgos pa med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bdag yongs su btang nas gzhan la phan par byed pa ni shin tu dgos pa med par ston pa'o //
translated: Giving oneself up to help others is shown to be utterly pointless.

original: gzhan don byed pa nyid bde ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan don byed pa nyid bde ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it happiness to help others?

original: thar par bdag gi don du 'bad rtsol byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: thar par bdag gi don du 'bad rtsol byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de lta na ni bdag gi bde bar 'khrul pas 'khrul pa dag gzhan gyi bde bas ji ltar grol bar 'gyur /
translated: If that is so, then how can those who are confused about their own happiness be liberated by the happiness of others?

analyzed: ji ltar yang 'khrul pas gzhan gyi bde ba skyed pa de bzhin du /

original: bud med la 'khyud par byed par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: bud med la 'khyud par byed par yang 'gyur te /

original: khrel dang bral ba'i spyod pa yin no //
