translated: If the self is not faulty by its very nature,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan yang ji ltar skyon can du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan yang ji ltar skyon can du 'gyur /
translated: how can it be faulty even though it is associated with attachment and so on?

original: dbyug pa dang ldan pas lha byin dbyug par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyug pa dang ldan pas lha byin dbyug par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because Lhejin is not a club just because he is associated with a club.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rigs pa med pa'i skyes bu 'dod chags can nyid du mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rigs pa med pa'i skyes bu 'dod chags can nyid du mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible that a person is desirous just because of the existence of attachment and so on.

original: 'on te tha dad pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rig pas 'dod chags can nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rig pas 'dod chags can nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if one is desirous because of the existence of attachment and so on that is different from him,

original: grogs dag 'o na ni bud med rig pa las bud med dang ldan par 'gyur ro //üîΩde bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'brel pas 'dod chags can gyi @384a * //üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grogs dag 'o na ni bud med rig pa las bud med dang ldan par 'gyur ro // de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'brel pas 'dod chags can gyi @384a * // 'dod chags la sogs pa rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then, my friend, one would be a woman because of the existence of a woman.üîΩTherefore, one is not desirous because of the connection with attachment and so on.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'dzin pas 'dod chags can du 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'dzin pas 'dod chags can du 'gyur na ni /
translated: One is not desirous because of the possession of attachment and so on.

original: gzhan gyis 'dod chags 'dzin pa yang 'dod chags can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'dod chags 'dzin pa yang 'dod chags can du 'gyur ro //
translated: And also, the one who possesses the attachment would be attached to another.

original: 'on te bdag dang 'du bas 'brel pa'i chags pa des 'dod chags can yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: 'on te bdag dang 'du bas 'brel pa'i chags pa des 'dod chags can yin no zhe na ;
translated: But if you say that he is attached because of the connection of the self with attachment,

original: 'phrod ba 'du ba yang tha dad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'phrod ba 'du ba yang tha dad pa ma yin nam /
translated: is not the connection of the self with attachment also a mere connection?

original: des na ji ltar phrad pa tsam la bud med dang ldan par mi brjod pa de bzhin du 'phrod pa 'du bas kyang 'dod chags can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ji ltar phrad pa tsam la bud med dang ldan par mi brjod pa de bzhin du 'phrod pa 'du bas kyang 'dod chags can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as one is not called ‚Äúendowed with a woman‚Äù merely through connection with a woman, so one would not be called ‚Äúattached‚Äù merely through connection with attachment.

original: 'on te 'dod chags bdag dang 'du ba gcig pas tha dad pa mi rig cing ldan pa can la ni tha dad pa'i blo skye'o zhe na ;
analyzed: 'on te 'dod chags bdag dang 'du ba gcig pas tha dad pa mi rig cing ldan pa can la ni tha dad pa'i blo skye'o zhe na ;
translated: But if you say that one is not aware of a difference because of the identity of the self with attachment, and that the awareness of difference arises in one who is endowed with attachment,

original: de lta na 'o na ni 'dod chags las bdag tha dad par ci yis shes /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni 'dod chags las bdag tha dad par ci yis shes /
translated: then, in that case, how is the self known to be different from attachment?

original: gang gi tshe bdag gi ngo bo tha dad par mi rig par de'i tshe bdag rig par ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag gi ngo bo tha dad par mi rig par de'i tshe bdag rig par ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: When the self is not known to be different in essence, then how can the self be known at all?

original: rang rig pa las 'khrul pa med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rang rig pa las 'khrul pa med do zhes bstan to //
translated: It has been shown that there is no error in reflexive awareness.

original: 'on te bdag rig par byed pa ma yin la rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te bdag rig par byed pa ma yin la rig par bya ba ste /
translated: But if the self is not the experiencer, then like external things, it is the experienced.

original: phyi rol bzhin no zhe na /üîΩ'o na ni gzung bya yin pa'i phyir rig bar byed pa med pas longs spyod pa por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi rol bzhin no zhe na / 'o na ni gzung bya yin pa'i phyir rig bar byed pa med pas longs spyod pa por mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the self is not the experiencer, then like external things, it is the experienced.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams spyad par bya ba nyid la spyod pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams spyad par bya ba nyid la spyod pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it is the experienced, then since it is not the experiencer, it cannot be the enjoyer, because there is no enjoyer in regard to form, etc., which are the objects of enjoyment.

original: de bas na bdag la longs spyod pa po tha dad bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na bdag la longs spyod pa po tha dad bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the enjoyer would be different from the self.

original: de la gzhan dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gzhan dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, there would be an infinite regress of enjoyers.

original: 'on te longs spyod pa der 'du bas 'brel pa'i phyir longs spyod pa por 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te longs spyod pa der 'du bas 'brel pa'i phyir longs spyod pa por 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the enjoyer is the enjoyer because it is related to the enjoyment,

original: longs spyod pa ni nyams su myong ba las tha dad pa ci yang med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: longs spyod pa ni nyams su myong ba las tha dad pa ci yang med pa ma yin nam /
translated: is not enjoyment nothing other than experience?

original: longs spyod pa ni spyad par bya ba la gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: longs spyod pa ni spyad par bya ba la gnas pa nyid de /
translated: Enjoyment is the very state of being the object of enjoyment.

original: ji ltar bdag longs spyod pa'o zhes bya ba'i blo skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag longs spyod pa'o zhes bya ba'i blo skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the thought ‚ÄúI am enjoying‚Äù arises,

original: 'di ni bdag gi longs spyod do zhes bya ba 'jig rten na snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi longs spyod do zhes bya ba 'jig rten na snang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is my property‚Äù is seen in the world.

original: de bas na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po gnyis ka la yod do //
analyzed: de bas na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po gnyis ka la yod do //
translated: Therefore, it exists both as a basis and as something based on it.

original: 'on te dpog par byed pa las 'di longs spyod pa por brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dpog par byed pa las 'di longs spyod pa por brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is called the experiencer because it is inferred,üîΩhow can it be inferred without direct perception?

original: mngon sum med par de la rjes su dpag pa ji ltar 'gyur 'on te bdag phra ba'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams kho nas yul du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum med par de la rjes su dpag pa ji ltar 'gyur 'on te bdag phra ba'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams kho nas yul du 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if you say that it is an object only for yogins because it is subtle,

original: da ltar bdag cag la sogs pa rnams kyis mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar bdag cag la sogs pa rnams kyis mi mthong zhe na /
translated: and that we cannot see it,

original: rnal 'byor pas mthong bar yang nges pa 'di na ci yang med do //üîΩgzhan yang bdag cag la sogs pa med par rig pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas mthong bar yang nges pa 'di na ci yang med do // gzhan yang bdag cag la sogs pa med par rig pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: then there is nothing at all that is certain to be seen by yogins.üîΩMoreover, we must accept that the self is by nature reflexive awareness,

original: bdag ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar khas blang bar bya @384b ste ;
analyzed: bdag ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar khas blang bar bya @384b ste ;
translated: because cognition is known to exist even when there is no ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na de med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would follow that the self does not exist.

original: de yang bde ba la sogs pa ri gang 'i  ngo bo nyid du 'gyur na ni de 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang bde ba la sogs pa ri gang 'i  ngo bo nyid du 'gyur na ni de 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if pleasure, etc. were the essence of the self, then it would be subject to destruction.

original: gang zhig bdag la zhen pa de'i bdag de ji ltar 'jig par 'dod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig bdag la zhen pa de'i bdag de ji ltar 'jig par 'dod par 'gyur /
translated: How could one who is attached to the self desire the destruction of that self?

original: bdag de ni sdug bsngal med pa'i ngo bo nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag de ni sdug bsngal med pa'i ngo bo nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: That self should be accepted as having the nature of being devoid of suffering.

original: gal te sdug bsngal ba can yin te /üîΩbde ba can ma yin na ni sdug bsngal gyi skabs na bdag rang nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal ba can yin te / bde ba can ma yin na ni sdug bsngal gyi skabs na bdag rang nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is painful,üîΩthen in the context of suffering, the self itself would not exist.

original: 'on te bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs nyid 'jig la bdag ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs nyid 'jig la bdag ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Or, if the context of pleasure and pain itself is destroyed, but not the self,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: bde ba la sogs pa ma gtogs par de mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ma gtogs par de mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not perceived apart from pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid bor na /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid bor na /
translated: Having abandoned the nature of pleasure, etc.,

original: rig pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du bdag snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rig pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du bdag snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: the self is not perceived as having a different nature from that of awareness.

original: de bas na ji ltar bde ba dang / sdug bsngal tha dad pa de bzhin du de'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag kyang tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar bde ba dang / sdug bsngal tha dad pa de bzhin du de'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag kyang tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as pleasure and pain are different, so too their intrinsic reality selves would be different.

original: 'on te rig pa dang / rig pa po zhes 'dzin pas bdag tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rig pa dang / rig pa po zhes 'dzin pas bdag tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the self is different because of the apprehension of the cognizer and the cognized,

original: 'o na ni myong ba dang myong ba bo zhes bya ba'i rtog pa las bdag tha dad na bdag gzhan las kyang tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni myong ba dang myong ba bo zhes bya ba'i rtog pa las bdag tha dad na bdag gzhan las kyang tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the self would be different from the other, because of the conception of the experience and the experiencer.

original: 'on te rang rig pas gzhan gyis bdag mi rig pa'i phyir tha dad do //
analyzed: 'on te rang rig pas gzhan gyis bdag mi rig pa'i phyir tha dad do //
translated: But if you think that the self is different because it is self-cognizing and not cognized by another,

original: bde ba rig pas kyang sdug bsngal mi rig pa'i phyir de rig pa tha dad pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba rig pas kyang sdug bsngal mi rig pa'i phyir de rig pa tha dad pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: then the self would be different from the cognizer, because pleasure is cognized but pain is not cognized.

original: des na snga phyi dag gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid 'jig par thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: des na snga phyi dag gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid 'jig par thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, because the prior and subsequent are not the same, it follows that the self would be destroyed.

original: bdag la zhen pa gang yin pa de ji ltar 'jig par 'dod par 'gyur ther zug pa'i rtag pa yin pas sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la zhen pa gang yin pa de ji ltar 'jig par 'dod par 'gyur ther zug pa'i rtag pa yin pas sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: How could one desire the destruction of that to which one is attached? It would be permanent and eternal, and would remain in the nature of suffering.

original: rtag pa ther zug pa yang phyi ma phyi ma'i gnas skabs rig pa ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtag pa ther zug pa yang phyi ma phyi ma'i gnas skabs rig pa ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that a permanent and eternal thing is not known in a subsequent state?

original: de ji ltar de nyid du gnas pa'i rtag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ji ltar de nyid du gnas pa'i rtag pa nyid yin te /
translated: How could it be permanent in the sense of remaining just as it is?

original: 'gyur ba dang rim gyis 'byung bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te de rim gyis dmigs pa yin ni de'i tshe 'jig pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang rim gyis 'byung bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro // gal te de rim gyis dmigs pa yin ni de'i tshe 'jig pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is observed to change and to occur in sequence.üîΩIf it is observed in sequence, then it is established as perishable.

original: de ltar gyur na rim gyis dmigs par 'dod na 'jig pa yang 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rim gyis dmigs par 'dod na 'jig pa yang 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that it is observed in sequence, then you must accept that it is perishable.

original: de lta na yang gang la bdag la zhen pa yod pa de la 'jig par 'dod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang la bdag la zhen pa yod pa de la 'jig par 'dod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how could one desire the destruction of that to which one is attached?

original: 'on te mtshungs pa de do nyid du dmigs pas snga phyi gcig pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mtshungs pa de do nyid du dmigs pas snga phyi gcig pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if it is observed to be the same in every moment, then it is the same in the past and the future.

original: tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong na tha dad pa nyid du gsal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩde ltar gyur na snga ma 'jig pa de bzhin du @385a * //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong na tha dad pa nyid du gsal ba'i phyir ro zhe na / de ltar gyur na snga ma 'jig pa de bzhin du @385a * //
translated: If you see them as having different natures, then because they are clearly different,

original: bdag la zhen pa gang yin pa de 'jig par 'dod pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag la zhen pa gang yin pa de 'jig par 'dod pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could you assert that the self is destroyed in the same way that the previous one was destroyed?

original: 'on te rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag la thams cad gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag la thams cad gcig pa nyid de /
translated: Or, if the nature of the self is conceived to be the same in all,

original: de yang khyad par can tha dad pas tha dad par snang ba ste /
analyzed: de yang khyad par can tha dad pas tha dad par snang ba ste /
translated: then it appears to be different because of the differences of the possessor.

original: dper na nam mkha' tha dad pa med kyang bum pa'i nam mkha' dang / snam bu'i nam mkha' zhes tha dad par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' tha dad pa med kyang bum pa'i nam mkha' dang / snam bu'i nam mkha' zhes tha dad par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, although space is not different, it is conceived to be different, as in the statements ‚Äúspace of the pot‚Äù and ‚Äúspace of the cloth.‚Äù

original: de bas na bdag tha dad par ma rig pas byas pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na bdag tha dad par ma rig pas byas pa'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the difference in the self is due to ignorance.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩgal te / ji ltar bum pa med na ni //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gal te / ji ltar bum pa med na ni //
translated: Here we say:üîΩIf, when there is no pot,

original: bum pa'i nam mkha' ma yin na //
analyzed: bum pa'i nam mkha' ma yin na //
translated: there is no space of the pot,

original: 'on ni bum pa med na nam mkha' gzhan dang lhan cig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir nam mkha' la tha dad pa med pa bzhin du bdag kyang tha dad pa med pas rang dang rang gzhan gyi cha tha mi dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag nyams pa nyid du
analyzed: 'on ni bum pa med na nam mkha' gzhan dang lhan cig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir nam mkha' la tha dad pa med pa bzhin du bdag kyang tha dad pa med pas rang dang rang gzhan gyi cha tha mi dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag nyams pa nyid du
translated: But if the pot does not exist, then space would be different from it, and just as space is not different from it, so the self would not be different from its own parts and from other things.üîΩThus the self would be destroyed.

original: 'gyur ro // nga'o snyam pa ni gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa la bya ba dang / longs spyod pa la sogs pa med pas nam mkha' bzhin tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // nga'o snyam pa ni gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa la bya ba dang / longs spyod pa la sogs pa med pas nam mkha' bzhin tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is of the nature of the exclusion of other, so the self is different from space, since it is not space, and it is not the object of action and experience.

original: de lta na ni gang bdag tu zhen pa de'i bdag de ni ji ltar 'jig par 'dod /
analyzed: de lta na ni gang bdag tu zhen pa de'i bdag de ni ji ltar 'jig par 'dod /
translated: If that is so, then how can the self that is conceived as ‚ÄúI‚Äù be destroyed?

original: 'on te dngos po'i stobs las 'ongs pa ji ltar brjod na ni bdag med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po'i stobs las 'ongs pa ji ltar brjod na ni bdag med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is said that it is by the power of things, then it follows that there is no self,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid rig pa tsam yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid rig pa tsam yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is only the mere awareness of its own nature.

original: 'on te rig pa nyid bdag yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rig pa nyid bdag yin te /
translated: But if awareness itself is the self,

original: rtag pa dang khyab pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: rtag pa dang khyab pa'o zhe na /
translated: If it is permanent and pervasive,

original: rig pa'i khyab pa nyid 'di gang zhig yin /
analyzed: rig pa'i khyab pa nyid 'di gang zhig yin /
translated: what is the pervasion of awareness?

original: phyogs thams cad mnan pa ni khyab pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad mnan pa ni khyab pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: Is not pervasion said to be the pressing down of all directions,

original: dus du ma la khyab pa ni rtag par brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dus du ma la khyab pa ni rtag par brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: and is not the pervasion of many times said to be permanence?

original: rang rig pas kyang yul dang dus kyi khyad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ji ltar bdag khyab pa dang rtag par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang rig pas kyang yul dang dus kyi khyad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ji ltar bdag khyab pa dang rtag par 'gyur /
translated: Since self-awareness also apprehends the distinctions of object and time, how could the self be pervasive and permanent?

original: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid du bdag gnas pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid du bdag gnas pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the self abides in the nature of another, such as a pot,

original: de lta na yang 'khor ba par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'khor ba par 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case it would be a transmigrator,

original: lha sbyin la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yang gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha sbyin la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yang gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would also abide in the nature of Devadatta and so on.

original: de bas na grol bar 'gyur na srog chags kyang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na grol bar 'gyur na srog chags kyang med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if it were liberated, it would be a living being,üîΩbecause such liberation would serve no purpose at all.

original: de lta bu'i thar pas ni dgos pa ci yang med pa'i phyir rtog pa sngon du btang ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams ngo mtshar skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i thar pas ni dgos pa ci yang med pa'i phyir rtog pa sngon du btang ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams ngo mtshar skyed pa yin no //
translated: The yogis who imagine it are amazing!

original: don dam par bdag bya ba dang longs spyod pa la sogs pa la brten pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: don dam par bdag bya ba dang longs spyod pa la sogs pa la brten pa ma yin nam /
translated: But in reality, it is not the basis of such things as self, action, and experience.

original: de ltar yang de ma rig pa'i bag chags kho na las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang de ma rig pa'i bag chags kho na las 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, it is only due to the latent propensities of ignorance that such things as attachment arise.

original: de bzhin du chags pa la sogs pa yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du chags pa la sogs pa yang yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the self is the basis of attachment, etc.,

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: we reply:üîΩThe self is the basis of all the conventions of experience,

original: myong ba'i tha snyad yon tan bdag / kun gyi rten ni ldog pa can //
analyzed: myong ba'i tha snyad yon tan bdag / kun gyi rten ni ldog pa can //
translated: and of the qualities, but not of attachment.

original: chags pa ru ni ji ltar @385b 'dod //
analyzed: chags pa ru ni ji ltar @385b 'dod //
translated: How can it be asserted that it is attached?

analyzed: chags pa'i rang bzhin de 'dra min // zhes bya ba la / gang la nam mkha' bzhin myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i tha snyad thams cad log pa yin pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams log pa yod pa de ni de lta bu'i bdag gi rten gang yin pa'i chags pa de ji ltar 'dod pa yin te /

original: 'di spong ma yin dper bdag bzhin //
analyzed: 'di spong ma yin dper bdag bzhin //

original: de phyir sdug bsngal bsgom don med //
analyzed: de phyir sdug bsngal bsgom don med //

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /

analyzed: 'on te bdag spong bar byed do zhe na //

original: spang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: spang bar mi nus te /

original: bdag spong ba ma yin gyi /

analyzed: da ni bdag la chags pa dang bral ba gang yin pa med la /

analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgoms pas kyang de dag / sdug bsngal ba nyid rnam bsgom 'gyur //

original: de ni sngar yang mngon sum nyid //
analyzed: de ni sngar yang mngon sum nyid //

analyzed: de lta 'ang chags bral ldan ma yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: but they are not free from attachment.

analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal bsgoms pa de chags pa dang bral bar gyur na / sdug bsngal bsgom par rigs na de ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i @387a * //
translated: Here, if the cultivation of the perception of suffering were to lead to freedom from attachment,

original: don ma yin no //
analyzed: don ma yin no //
translated: it would be reasonable to cultivate the perception of suffering. But that is not the purpose of freedom from suffering.

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa sdug bsngal bsgoms pas sdug bsngal nyid rnams par bsgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogi/nƒ´ cultivates the perception of suffering through the cultivation of the perception of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal de yang sngar 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na mngon sum nyid de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yang sngar 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na mngon sum nyid de /

analyzed: sdug bsngal mngon du byed pa de lta na yang chags pa dang bral bar gnas pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: sdug bsngal mngon du ma gyur na rnal mar mi 'gyur zhing /

original: sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The suffering of being separated from what is attractive, etc. is directly perceived by everyone in the world.

original: gal te yang de'i tshe chags pa dang bral ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te yang de'i tshe chags pa dang bral ba ma yin na /
translated: Moreover, if one were not free from attachment at that time,

original: sdug bsngal bsgoms pas ji ltar chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgoms pas ji ltar chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: how could one become free from attachment through cultivating the perception of suffering?

original: 'on te sdug bsngal bsgoms pas dran pa thams cad bsres nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyun chen po goms pa la zhugs pa'i phyir chags pa dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal bsgoms pas dran pa thams cad bsres nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyun chen po goms pa la zhugs pa'i phyir chags pa dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one were to cultivate the perception of suffering by mixing all recollections together, then one would become free from attachment because one would be engaged in cultivating the great continuum of suffering.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi rgyun dran pas bsgom pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi rgyun dran pas bsgom pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as one cultivates the perception of the continuum of suffering,

original: bde ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa des chags pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa des chags pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who is attached to the pleasure of the meditative absorptions will be reborn in the world of BrahmƒÅ.

original: 'on te zhi ba'i bde ba'i ro las mi g-yo ba'i rnal 'byor pa 'khor ba'i bde ba 'dod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te zhi ba'i bde ba'i ro las mi g-yo ba'i rnal 'byor pa 'khor ba'i bde ba 'dod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the ascetic is not attached to the pleasure of the meditative absorptions, he will not be reborn in the world of BrahmƒÅ.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang ldan pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa kho na la skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang ldan pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa kho na la skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The ascetic who is attached to the pleasure of the meditative absorptions will be reborn in the world of BrahmƒÅ.

original: dur khrod na gnas pa'i bya rog gi skye ba'i rgyu ci ste /
analyzed: dur khrod na gnas pa'i bya rog gi skye ba'i rgyu ci ste /
translated: What is the cause of the birth of a crow in a charnel ground?üîΩIt is not the meditative absorption, but rather the attachment to impure things.

original: de nyid ma yin te 'di ltar bya rog ni mi gtsang ba'i gnas la dga' ba skye ba ji lta ba de bzhin du padma'i tshogs la dga' ba skye ba ma yin no //üîΩdes na sdug bsngal bsgoms pas sdug bsngal mngon sum du byas kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ma yin te 'di ltar bya rog ni mi gtsang ba'i gnas la dga' ba skye ba ji lta ba de bzhin du padma'i tshogs la dga' ba skye ba ma yin no // des na sdug bsngal bsgoms pas sdug bsngal mngon sum du byas kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, the attachment to the pleasure of the meditative absorptions is the cause of rebirth in the world of BrahmƒÅ.üîΩThe cultivation of the notion of suffering is useless, for the ascetic, even if he cultivates it, does not become detached.

original: sdug bsngal sgom pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sgom pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ascetic who cultivates the notion of suffering sees only suffering in the pleasure that is clear and evident to him; but this cultivation does not detach him from pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu skyon mthong ba las chags pa dang bral bar mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu skyon mthong ba las chags pa dang bral bar mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that one becomes free from attachment through seeing the faults that are the cause of suffering?

original: de ji ltar skyon mthong yang sdug bsngal bsgoms pas chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar skyon mthong yang sdug bsngal bsgoms pas chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that, even though one sees the faults, one does not become free from attachment through cultivating the idea of suffering?

original: smras pa / gal te gcig la'ang nyes pa yis //
analyzed: smras pa / gal te gcig la'ang nyes pa yis //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: skad cig de la blo ldog kyang //
analyzed: skad cig de la blo ldog kyang //
translated: Even though the mind turns away

original: 'dod ldan bud med gzhan la bzhin //
analyzed: 'dod ldan bud med gzhan la bzhin //
translated: from one woman because of her faults,

original: de la'ang chags bral nyid ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩgal te yang 'gro ba bzang mo gcig log par byed pa'i @387b nyes pa mthong nas skad cig tsam chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang bud med de la thams cad du chags pa dang bral ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la'ang chags bral nyid ma yin // zhes bya ba la / gal te yang 'gro ba bzang mo gcig log par byed pa'i @387b nyes pa mthong nas skad cig tsam chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang bud med de la thams cad du chags pa dang bral ba ma yin te /
translated: it is not free from attachmentüîΩto her as well, just like a lustful man.üîΩEven though the mind of a man who is attracted to a woman turns away from one woman because of her faults, it does not become free from attachment to her.

original: dper na 'dod pa dang ldan pa dag 'dod pa kha cig bu mo kha cig la chags pa log kyang bu mo gzhan la chags pa mi ldog pa ste /
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa dang ldan pa dag 'dod pa kha cig bu mo kha cig la chags pa log kyang bu mo gzhan la chags pa mi ldog pa ste /
translated: For example, even though a lustful man‚Äôs attachment to one woman is destroyed, his attachment to another woman is not destroyed.

original: rim gyis thams cad la chags pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gyis thams cad la chags pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because gradually attachment to all arises.

original: 'o na gal te blo la lar rnam par g-yo na yul kun la chags pa ci ste skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te blo la lar rnam par g-yo na yul kun la chags pa ci ste skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the mind is fickle in some places, why does attachment to all objects arise?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / blang dang dor ba'i khyad yod na //
analyzed: smras pa / blang dang dor ba'i khyad yod na //
translated: When there is a difference of accepting and rejecting,

original: gcig tu gyur pa'i chags gang nyid //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pa'i chags gang nyid //
translated: there is attachment to what is one.

original: de ni rnam grangs kyis bskyed tshe //üîΩchags pa rnams kyi sa bon yin //
analyzed: de ni rnam grangs kyis bskyed tshe // chags pa rnams kyi sa bon yin //
translated: When that is generated by way of enumeration,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is the seed of the attachments.

original: gang la blang ba dang dor ba'i khyad par yod pa de la 'dod pa dang sdang bar 'gyur gyi thams cad la len pa dang / 'dor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la blang ba dang dor ba'i khyad par yod pa de la 'dod pa dang sdang bar 'gyur gyi thams cad la len pa dang / 'dor ba ma yin te /
translated: When there is a difference of accepting and rejecting, there is desire and hatred, but not for all.

original: rnam grangs pas 'dod pa dang / sdang ba phan tshun rgyu can gyi rnam grangs par 'gyur ba kho na'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam grangs pas 'dod pa dang / sdang ba phan tshun rgyu can gyi rnam grangs par 'gyur ba kho na'i phyir //
translated: Because desire and hatred are mutually causal, they are only generated by way of enumeration.

original: bdag tu smra ba ji ltar grol bar 'gyur de bas na blang ba dang dor ba dag mi mthun pa dang dngos po gcig la skye ba'i ngang tshul can gyi 'dod chags zhes bya ba'i zhen pa gang yin pa de nyid dngos po thams cad kyi sa bon
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba ji ltar grol bar 'gyur de bas na blang ba dang dor ba dag mi mthun pa dang dngos po gcig la skye ba'i ngang tshul can gyi 'dod chags zhes bya ba'i zhen pa gang yin pa de nyid dngos po thams cad kyi sa bon
translated: Therefore, the seed of all things is the attachment called ‚Äúthe nature of being desirous,‚Äù which is the cause of the distinction between what is to be accepted and what is to be rejected.

original: te / chags pa ste 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams rim gyis skye'o //
analyzed: te / chags pa ste 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams rim gyis skye'o //
translated: From that, desire, which is the nature of attachment, and so on, arise in sequence.

original: bdag med par mthong ba can gyis ni thams cad du btang snyoms te /
analyzed: bdag med par mthong ba can gyis ni thams cad du btang snyoms te /
translated: But those who see selflessness are indifferent to everything.

original: blang ba dang / dor ba'i khyad par yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blang ba dang / dor ba'i khyad par yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no distinction between what is to be accepted and what is to be rejected.

original: de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, desire and so on do not arise,

original: chags pa'i rtsa ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang chags pa dang bral ba nyid du ni dngos po ngan pa la 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: chags pa'i rtsa ba med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang chags pa dang bral ba nyid du ni dngos po ngan pa la 'gyur gyi //
translated: because the root of desire is absent.üîΩMoreover, the view of a self is not taught as an inferior thing,

original: bdag tu lta ba ni gang du rnag bzhin dman pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni gang du rnag bzhin dman pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of freedom from attachment.

original: chags pa skyon med yul can te //
analyzed: chags pa skyon med yul can te //
translated: The object of the faultless attachment

original: sgrub byed kyang ni skyon med yin //
analyzed: sgrub byed kyang ni skyon med yin //
translated: The proof is also faultless.

original: 'gro ba de tsam kho na na //
analyzed: 'gro ba de tsam kho na na //
translated: The world is just that much.

original: da ni gang las chags bral 'gyur //
analyzed: da ni gang las chags bral 'gyur //
translated: Now, from what will one be free of attachment?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de la bdag skyon dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la bdag skyon dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, the self is not faulty,

original: de dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dben pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i yul can chags pa yang skyon med pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul can chags pa yang skyon med pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir skyon med pa'o //
translated: The attachment that has it as its object is also faultless, because it has a faultless object.

original: longs spyod pa'i sgrub byed mig la sogs pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i sgrub byed mig la sogs pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: The proof of the enjoyment, the eyes, etc., is also like that.

original: 'gro ba thams cad de tsam kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad de tsam kho na yin na /
translated: The world is just that much.

original: da ni gang la de chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: da ni gang la de chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: Now, from what will one be free of attachment?

original: 'on te skyon bcas yin na'ang de //
analyzed: 'on te skyon bcas yin na'ang de //
translated: But even if it is faulty,

original: der ni bdag dang de mtshungs la //
analyzed: der ni bdag dang de mtshungs la //
translated: the self is similar to that.

original: de skyon de la chags bral min //
analyzed: de skyon de la chags bral min //
translated: It is not free of attachment to that fault.

original: de dag gang la chags bral @388a * //
analyzed: de dag gang la chags bral @388a * //
translated: To what will they be free of attachment?

original: 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa yul dang lus la sogs pa de la chags pa skyon dang bcas par snang na ni /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa yul dang lus la sogs pa de la chags pa skyon dang bcas par snang na ni /
translated: But if the attachment to those objects such as form, and to the body, etc., appears to be faulty,

original: bde ba'i rgyu de dag skyon dang bcas pa nyid du ci ste 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu de dag skyon dang bcas pa nyid du ci ste 'gyur /
translated: Why would the causes of pleasure be faulty?üîΩBecause they are the cause of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin pas so zhe na chags pa ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du rnam grangs kyis 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin pas so zhe na chags pa ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du rnam grangs kyis 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Attachment is the cause of pleasure and the cause of suffering, in turn.

original: res 'ga' de dag sdug bsngal gyi yang rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: res 'ga' de dag sdug bsngal gyi yang rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Sometimes they are not the cause of suffering.

original: grol bar 'dod pa'i bdag de la yang skyon dang bcas pa nyid du mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: grol bar 'dod pa'i bdag de la yang skyon dang bcas pa nyid du mtshungs pa ma yin nam /

original: chags pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i bdag de la chags pa dang ma bral na /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i bdag de la chags pa dang ma bral na /

original: da ni gang la chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: da ni gang la chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur /

original: 'on te bdag spang bar mi nus na zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag spang bar mi nus na zhe na /

analyzed: 'o na ni bdag gi ba yang spong ba ma yin no // 'on te bdag gi ba skyon yod pas spong ngo zhe na /

analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe bdag gi ba de'i skyon mthong ba de'i tshe spong bar 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: gang gi tshe bde ba'i rgyu nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe ji ltar spong pa yin /

analyzed: 'o na gal te bde ba'i rgyu ma spangs par bral bar gyur kyang de'i tshe bde ba yang sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /

original: bde ba'i rgyu yang spang bar rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu yang spang bar rigs so zhe na /

original: de lta na sdug bsngal gyi rjes la bde ba chen po skye ba'i phyir sdug bsngal blang bar bya ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na sdug bsngal gyi rjes la bde ba chen po skye ba'i phyir sdug bsngal blang bar bya ba nyid ma yin nam /

analyzed: de bas na bdag tu lta ba 'di gang du yang chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: gzhan yang / yon tan mthong las chags pa 'byung //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yon tan mthong las chags pa 'byung //

original: skyon mthong bas ni 'gegs 'gyur na //
analyzed: skyon mthong bas ni 'gegs 'gyur na //
translated: But it is stopped by seeing faults.

original: de ltar de dbang sogs la min //
analyzed: de ltar de dbang sogs la min //

analyzed: bus pa sogs la'ang yod phyir dang // skyon dang ldan la'ang yod phyir dang // yon tan ldan pa gzhan dag la'ang //

original: med phyir bdag gi ba yod na'ang //
analyzed: med phyir bdag gi ba yod na'ang //
translated: If there were a self,

original: 'das sogs la ni med phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das sogs la ni med phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist in the past, etc.üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: yon tan mthong pa las chags pa skye zhing skyon mthong bas 'gegs par 'gyur ro zhe na /

original: chags pa de nyid kyang mig la sogs pa las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: chags pa de nyid kyang mig la sogs pa las mi 'byung ste /

original: 'on kyang bdag gi bar mthong ba las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gi bar mthong ba las yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du bus pa dang phyugs la sogs pa skyon dang yon tan mi spyod pa can rnams la chags pa yod pa'i phyir dang / rab rib la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i mig la sogs pa skyon dang ldan pa la bdag gi bar yongs su 'dzin pa'i dga' ba yod pa'i phyir dang /
translated: In the same way, children, cattle, etc., which are not endowed with faults and good qualities, are the objects of attachment. And the eyes, etc., which are endowed with faults, such as cataracts, are the objects of the pleasure of grasping what is mine.

original: gzhan @388b gyi mig la sogs pa yon tan dang ldan pa yin yang bdag gi yin par ma mthong ba la su yang chags pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa la sogs pa zhig pa la bdag gi bar chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan @388b gyi mig la sogs pa yon tan dang ldan pa yin yang bdag gi yin par ma mthong ba la su yang chags pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa la sogs pa zhig pa la bdag gi bar chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because no one is attached to the eyes, etc., of others, even though they are endowed with good qualities, because they are not seen as mine, and because there is no attachment to what is mine in the past, etc., which has perished.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma thob pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma thob pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include non-acquisition.

original: de bas na skyon mthong ba las chags pa ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skyon mthong ba las chags pa ldog pa ma yin no //

original: 'on te skyon mthong ba las bdag gi ba'i blo nyid ldog par 'dod cing /
analyzed: 'on te skyon mthong ba las bdag gi ba'i blo nyid ldog par 'dod cing /

analyzed: de dang bral na yon tan las skyes pa'i chags pa yang mi 'byung ste /

analyzed: de'i tshe bdag gi bar lta ba ni skyon mthong bas gsal ba'i phyir ro snyam sems na /

original: smras pa / de nyid phyir ni bdag gi blo //
analyzed: smras pa / de nyid phyir ni bdag gi blo //
translated: That very idea of ‚Äúmine‚Äù

original: yon tan mthong ba'i rgyu ma yin //
analyzed: yon tan mthong ba'i rgyu ma yin //
translated: is not the cause of seeing good qualities.

original: de phyir yon tan mi mthong phyir //üîΩde yang nyams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de phyir yon tan mi mthong phyir // de yang nyams pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of not seeing good qualities,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: that view of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is not destroyed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skyon dang ldan pa yin yang 'ga' zhig tu bdag gi pa'i blo yod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yon tan ldan pa gzhan dag la med pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa la sogs pa la yang med pa'i phyir bdag gi ba'i blo ni yon tan mthong ba'i rgyu ma yin no //

original: de'i phyir bdag gi ba'i blo de yang nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gi ba'i blo de yang nyams par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa'i skyon mthong yang ngo //

original: gzhan yang yon tan med sgro 'dogs //
analyzed: gzhan yang yon tan med sgro 'dogs //
translated: Moreover, one superimposes the absence of good qualities,

original: chags las de ni snang ba yin //
analyzed: chags las de ni snang ba yin //
translated: and that appears due to attachment.

original: de phyir de rgyu la gnod med //
analyzed: de phyir de rgyu la gnod med //
translated: Therefore, there is no impairment of the cause of that,

original: sgrub pa de la ji ltar gnod //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: sgrub pa de la ji ltar gnod // ces bya ba la /
translated: and how is that proof impaired?

original: gal te skyon mthong bar nus na ni skyon mthong ba na chags pa ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te skyon mthong bar nus na ni skyon mthong ba na chags pa ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: If one is able to see faults, then when one sees faults, attachment is stopped,

original: gang gi phyir chags pa'i stobs kyis skyon mthong ba nyid du mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chags pa'i stobs kyis skyon mthong ba nyid du mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because through the power of attachment one does not see faults.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i yon tan nye bar len pa bdag gi bar chags pa de las mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i yon tan nye bar len pa bdag gi bar chags pa de las mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One would become attached to a self that appropriates nonexistent qualities.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: chags pa'i rgyu bdag tu 'dzin pa na /
analyzed: chags pa'i rgyu bdag tu 'dzin pa na /
translated: when one is attached to the cause of appropriation,

original: mi gnod pa'i sgrub pa gang yin pa sdug bsngal bsgom pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de yis ji ltar chags pa de 'gegs par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi gnod pa'i sgrub pa gang yin pa sdug bsngal bsgom pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de yis ji ltar chags pa de 'gegs par 'gyur /
translated: how could the essence of the meditation on suffering and so on, which is the means of non-harm, stop that attachment?

original: de bas na bdag tu lta ba ni grol ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag tu lta ba ni grol ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the view of self is not liberation.

original: 'di la grangs can gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la grangs can gyis smras pa /
translated: Here, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya says:

original: bdag tu lta ba ni sdug bsngal bsgom par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni sdug bsngal bsgom par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The view of self is not the meditation on suffering.

original: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid kyis skyes bu tha dad pa shes pas grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid kyis skyes bu tha dad pa shes pas grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: Rather, one is liberated by the knowledge of the distinct person that exists by its very nature.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu ni mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid can no //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu ni mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid can no //
translated: Thus, the person has an unchanging nature.

original: rang bzhin ni bde ba la sogs pa gzhan dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni bde ba la sogs pa gzhan dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The nature of pleasure and so on is to change from one to another.

original: de bas na de dag @389a * //
analyzed: de bas na de dag @389a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: dpyod pa med pas bzung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dpyod pa med pas bzung ba'i phyir //
translated: because it is apprehended without analysis.

original: bdag grol ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag grol ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The self is not liberated.

original: skyes bu 'ba' zhig shes pas grol bar 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / mchog gzhan don du gnyer phyir dang // skye 'jig blo can nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: skyes bu 'ba' zhig shes pas grol bar 'gyur ro zhe na / smras pa / mchog gzhan don du gnyer phyir dang // skye 'jig blo can nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Only the person is liberated by knowledge.üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says: Because the best strive for the sake of others

original: skye bo 'di yis dbang sogs las //
analyzed: skye bo 'di yis dbang sogs las //
translated: and because they have the insight that sees production and cessation,

original: bdag ni tha dad gyur par shes //
analyzed: bdag ni tha dad gyur par shes //
translated: this person knows that the self is differentüîΩfrom the faculties such as sight.

original: de phyir gcig nyid mthong bas kyang //üîΩchags min chags gyur de bdag dang // dmigs pa'i nang gi yan lag la //
analyzed: de phyir gcig nyid mthong bas kyang // chags min chags gyur de bdag dang // dmigs pa'i nang gi yan lag la //
translated: Therefore, even though he sees that they are the same,üîΩhe is not attached to them.üîΩThe self is attached to the internal parts

original: ngo bo nyid kyis rjes chags 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la //üîΩskye ba dang 'jig pa mthong ba nyid tha dad par 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis rjes chags 'gyur // zhes bya ba la // skye ba dang 'jig pa mthong ba nyid tha dad par 'jig pa ste /
translated: that are the objects of its attachment.üîΩThe insight that sees production and cessation is different from the insight that sees their continuity.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is different from the insight that sees their continuity because it sees their cessation.

original: bdag ni rjes su 'gro ba can te /
analyzed: bdag ni rjes su 'gro ba can te /
translated: The self is not continuous.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ma yin pa can no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ma yin pa can no //
translated: It is not continuous with pleasure, etc.

original: de bas na 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is the abode of mutually exclusive attributes, it is different.

original: 'on te tha dad pa nyid 'khor ba pas ma dpyad pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa nyid 'khor ba pas ma dpyad pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if it is different, then the transmigrator would not be analyzed.

original: de lta na 'o na ni dpyod pas zhen pa med pa'i phyir grol ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni dpyod pas zhen pa med pa'i phyir grol ba ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then since analysis does not cling, one is not liberated,

original: bde ba don du gnyer bas bde ba spong bar 'bad pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir bde ba dang bral ba'i bdag la su yang don du gnyer ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba don du gnyer bas bde ba spong bar 'bad pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir bde ba dang bral ba'i bdag la su yang don du gnyer ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because no one strives for a self that is devoid of pleasure, since those who strive for pleasure do not strive for the abandonment of pleasure.

original: bdag 'ba' zhig skye ba'i sngon nas yod na ni /
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig skye ba'i sngon nas yod na ni /
translated: If only the self existed prior to birth,

original: 'khor ba med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then there would be no cyclic existence.

original: gang gi tshe gtso bo dang lhan cig par bdag ma mthong ba de'i tshe grol bar 'dod la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gtso bo dang lhan cig par bdag ma mthong ba de'i tshe grol bar 'dod la /
translated: When the self is not seen together with the principal, then it is asserted that one is liberated.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin dang lhan cig tu mthong ba de'i tshe 'khor ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin dang lhan cig tu mthong ba de'i tshe 'khor ba'o zhe na /
translated: When it is seen together with the nature, then it is cyclic existence.

original: de la bdag rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: de la bdag rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: If the self has the nature of conceptualization,

original: ji ltar gcig pa nyid du 'khrul bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig pa nyid du 'khrul bar 'gyur /
translated: how could it be mistaken as being the same?

original: 'on te yul la zhen pa ni grol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te yul la zhen pa ni grol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if clinging to objects does not liberate one,

original: 'khor bar skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'khor bar skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because one is born in cyclic existence,üîΩthen how could the self be liberated?

original: rang bzhin la 'khrul pa med de bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin la 'khrul pa med de bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature is not deluded, because it is inert.

original: de bas na ci'i phyir bdag nyid chen po dang gcig par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na ci'i phyir bdag nyid chen po dang gcig par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it be identical with the great self?

original: ji ltar bdag la 'khrul pa med pa de ltar bstan zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag la 'khrul pa med pa de ltar bstan zin to //
translated: It has been shown how the self is not deluded.

original: 'on te rang bzhin yul nyid du mthong na ni /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin yul nyid du mthong na ni /
translated: But if the nature is seen as an object,

original: 'o na tha dad par 'dzin pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na tha dad par 'dzin pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the apprehension of difference would not occur.

original: de bas na rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid dang rang bzhin la tha dad par shes te /
analyzed: de bas na rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid dang rang bzhin la tha dad par shes te /
translated: Therefore, the nature is known to be different from the essence of thought.

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa bzhin dang gzhan don du gnyer ba'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa skye ba dang / 'jig pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dbang po la sogs pa las bdag tha dad par skye bo thams cad kyis 'di shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa bzhin dang gzhan don du gnyer ba'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa skye ba dang / 'jig pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dbang po la sogs pa las bdag tha dad par skye bo thams cad kyis 'di shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the eye and so on, because it is the aim of others, and because it is the apprehender of the arising and destruction of the eye and so on, the self is known by all people to be different from the sense faculties and so on.

original: gang gi phyir @389b de lta yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir @389b de lta yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And because of that,

original: rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag gcig pa mthong ba las kyang bdag la chags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag gcig pa mthong ba las kyang bdag la chags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the self is not attached to the nature, even though it is seen as identical with the person.

original: gal te bdag la chags pa yod na de yang 'khor ba pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bdag la chags pa yod na de yang 'khor ba pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the one who is attached to the self is the transmigrator,

original: de lta na ni dmigs pa'i nang gi yan lag mig la sogs pa rnams la ngo bo nyid de rang bzhin nyid du rjes su chags pa dang ldan par 'gyur gyi re 'ga' grol ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni dmigs pa'i nang gi yan lag mig la sogs pa rnams la ngo bo nyid de rang bzhin nyid du rjes su chags pa dang ldan par 'gyur gyi re 'ga' grol ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: then the eye and so on, which are the internal perceptual sources, would be the self, because they are the basis of attachment. But the one who is liberated is not that at all.

original: 'on te sdug bsngal myong ba las dmigs pa kho nas tha dad par shes na /
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal myong ba las dmigs pa kho nas tha dad par shes na /
translated: But if you think that the self is known to be different from the experience of suffering,

original: de ji ltar sdug bsngal mthong ba na chags pa dang bral ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar sdug bsngal mthong ba na chags pa dang bral ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: then why is it not free from attachment when suffering is seen?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: sdug bsngal da ltar 'byung gang las //üîΩyid 'byung de 'dra sdang yin gyi //
analyzed: sdug bsngal da ltar 'byung gang las // yid 'byung de 'dra sdang yin gyi //
translated: From what suffering arises in the present,

original: chags bral ma yin de tshe 'ang 'di //
analyzed: chags bral ma yin de tshe 'ang 'di //
translated: that is the cause of aversion, not freedom from attachment.üîΩEven then, it seeks another occasion

original: chags yod skabs gzhan tshol phyir ro //
analyzed: chags yod skabs gzhan tshol phyir ro //
translated: when there is attachment.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / zhe sdang sdug bsngal rgyu nyid phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir / zhe sdang sdug bsngal rgyu nyid phyir //
translated: because aversion is the cause of suffering,

original: de ni de tsam nyid du gnas //
analyzed: de ni de tsam nyid du gnas //
translated: it remains just as it is.

original: de log na ni rang nyid kyi //
analyzed: de log na ni rang nyid kyi //
translated: But when it is eliminated,

original: rang bzhin yang ni bstan par 'gyur //
analyzed: rang bzhin yang ni bstan par 'gyur //
translated: its intrinsic reality will be revealed.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgang zhig de ltar ba'i sdug bsngal las yid 'byung ba de 'dra ba ni zhe sdang yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / gang zhig de ltar ba'i sdug bsngal las yid 'byung ba de 'dra ba ni zhe sdang yin gyi /
translated: The root text says:

original: chags pa dang bral ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Whoever is disgusted with suffering in this way is hateful, not free from attachment.üîΩWhy?

original: gang gi phyir da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar gyur pas yid 'byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar gyur pas yid 'byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: Because when one is disgusted with the present suffering that is being experienced,

original: skyes bu 'di la chags pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di la chags pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: then this person is still attached.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bde ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas skabs gzhan don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bde ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas skabs gzhan don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because he is seeking another state that has the nature of pleasure.

original: ;'on te zhe sdang nyid rtag tu yod pas chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ;'on te zhe sdang nyid rtag tu yod pas chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if hatred itself always exists, then one would be free from attachment,

original: des kyang yul spang ba'i phyir thar pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: des kyang yul spang ba'i phyir thar pa yod do zhe na /
translated: and because of that, there would be liberation from objects.

original: de ni ma yin te zhe sdang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhe sdang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because hatred is the cause of suffering.

original: zhe sdang de ni dus ji srid du sdug bsngal de de srid de tsam nyid du gnas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang de ni dus ji srid du sdug bsngal de de srid de tsam nyid du gnas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Hatred exists for as long as suffering exists.

original: sdug bsngal de log na ni zhe sdang yang ldog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de log na ni zhe sdang yang ldog pa'i phyir /
translated: If that suffering were to cease, then hatred would also cease.

original: rang nyid dus yun ring por bde ba don du gnyer ba'i rang bzhin la brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang nyid dus yun ring por bde ba don du gnyer ba'i rang bzhin la brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one would be dependent on a nature that seeks happiness for a long time.

original: de bas na sdug bsngal ni zhe sdang dang ldan pas grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na sdug bsngal ni zhe sdang dang ldan pas grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, suffering is not liberated by being associated with hatred.

original: 'on te yid 'byung ba med par grol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te yid 'byung ba med par grol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if one is not disgusted, one is not liberated,

original: yid ma byung ba 'ga' zhig kyang 'khor ba las grol bar don du gnyer ba ni rang bzhin la brten pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ma byung ba 'ga' zhig kyang 'khor ba las grol bar don du gnyer ba ni rang bzhin la brten pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who is not disgusted does not seek liberation from cyclic existence, being dependent on a nature.

original: sdug bsngal gyis ma gzir bar su yang yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis ma gzir bar su yang yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: If one is not oppressed by suffering, one will not be disgusted.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: blang dang dor ba bcom pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blang dang dor ba bcom pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the destruction of acceptance and rejection,üîΩone who abides equally

original: kun la mnyam par gnas pa la //
analyzed: kun la mnyam par gnas pa la //
translated: with regard to everything

original: chags bral zhes ni brjod @390a * //
analyzed: chags bral zhes ni brjod @390a * //
translated: is said to be ‚Äúfree from attachment,‚Äù

original: pa yin // tsandan dang ni ste'u bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pa yin // tsandan dang ni ste'u bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: like sandalwood and urine.

original: chos nyid tsam zhig mngon du byas pa'i phyir chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid thob nas blang ba dang / dor bar bya ba'i dngos po kun la go rims bzhin du len pa dang / spong ba dag bcom pa'i mnyam pa gang yin pa thams cad la mnyam pa nyid de ni 'dod chags dang bral bar brjod de /
analyzed: chos nyid tsam zhig mngon du byas pa'i phyir chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid thob nas blang ba dang / dor bar bya ba'i dngos po kun la go rims bzhin du len pa dang / spong ba dag bcom pa'i mnyam pa gang yin pa thams cad la mnyam pa nyid de ni 'dod chags dang bral bar brjod de /
translated: That sameness is called freedom from attachment.

original: gang rnams kyi yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang rnams kyi yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: ste'us 'jog pa la yang tsandan gyis byug pa lta bur sems pa de rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: ste'us 'jog pa la yang tsandan gyis byug pa lta bur sems pa de rnams kyi yin no //
translated: It is the thought that even if one is placed on a stake, one is anointed with sandalwood paste.

original: 'o na gal te sdug bsngal bsgom pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyu ma yin na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te sdug bsngal bsgom pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyu ma yin na ni /
translated: If the meditation on suffering is not the cause of freedom from attachment,

original: de lta ni 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal bsgom par gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta ni 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal bsgom par gsungs te /
translated: then why did the BhagavƒÅn teach the meditation on suffering?

original: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal nyid du rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal nyid du rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Did he not say, ‚ÄúSuffering should be known as suffering itself‚Äù?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal nyid mkhyen nas //
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal nyid mkhyen nas //
translated: Knowing the suffering of formations,

original: sdug bsngal bsgom par gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgom par gsungs pa yin //
translated: It is said that suffering is to be cultivated.

original: kho bo'i de yang rkyen las byung //
analyzed: kho bo'i de yang rkyen las byung //
translated: But that is also arisen from conditions.

original: de bdag med lta'i rten can yin //
analyzed: de bdag med lta'i rten can yin //
translated: It is based on the view of selflessness.

original: stong nyid lta bas grol 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: stong nyid lta bas grol 'gyur gyi //
translated: Liberation is through the view of emptiness.

original: bsgom pa lhag ma de'i don can //
analyzed: bsgom pa lhag ma de'i don can //
translated: The remaining meditations have that as their purpose.

original: de phyir mi rtag las sdug bsngal //
analyzed: de phyir mi rtag las sdug bsngal //
translated: Therefore, from impermanence comes suffering,

original: sdug bsngal las ni bdag med gsungs //üîΩzhes bya ba la //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las ni bdag med gsungs // zhes bya ba la //
translated: and from suffering comes selflessness.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal la brten nas sdug bsngal bsgom par gsungs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal la brten nas sdug bsngal bsgom par gsungs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that suffering is taught to be cultivated on the basis of the suffering of suffering.

original: 'on kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rgyu dang 'brel ba nyid du mkhyen nas sdug bsngal bsgom par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rgyu dang 'brel ba nyid du mkhyen nas sdug bsngal bsgom par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: But rather, suffering is taught to be cultivated by knowing the nature of the suffering of conditioned states in terms of its relation to its cause.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal de yang rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal de yang rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: That suffering of conditioned states is by nature arisen from causes and conditions.

original: don dam par bdag med par lta ba la brten pa can yin no //
analyzed: don dam par bdag med par lta ba la brten pa can yin no //
translated: It is based on the view of ultimate selflessness.

original: de bas na gang zag dang chos spong ba nyid du lta bas grol ba nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bas na gang zag dang chos spong ba nyid du lta bas grol ba nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, liberation is through the view of the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa bsgom pa lhag ma ni bdag med par lta ba de'i don can yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa bsgom pa lhag ma ni bdag med par lta ba de'i don can yin no //
translated: The rest of the meditation on suffering, etc. has the meaning of the view of selflessness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa thams cad ni bdag med par lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa thams cad ni bdag med par lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin no //

analyzed: snga phyi med par 'dzin pa med na ni rtag pa nyid 'dzin pa ma yin no //

original: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin no //

original: de phyir grol 'dod thog med pa'i //
analyzed: de phyir grol 'dod thog med pa'i //
translated: Therefore, one who desires liberation should destroy

analyzed: phyir ; ; sdig pa bcom par byas pa min // 'di yi lci ba nyid med kyang //
